table.name: ACTUALACTION
table.remarks: Lists and defines the meanings of the antivirus remediation action integers. The action integers represent the actions that the antivirus engine can take when dealing with a threat.

column.name: ACTUALACTION
column.remarks:
A hard-coded English string used for the following lookups:
-1 = Action invalid
1 = Quarantined
2 = Renamed
3 = Deleted
4 = Left alone
5 = Cleaned
6 = Cleaned or macros deleted
7 = Saved
9 = Moved back
10 = Renamed back
11 = Undone
12 = Bad
13 = Backed up
14 = Pending repair
15 = Partially repaired
16 = Process termination pending restart
17 = Excluded
18 = Restart processing
19 = Cleaned by deletion
20 = Access denied
21 = Process terminated
22 = No repair available
23 = All actions failed
24 = RepairFailedPowerEraser. A Power Eraser scan is recommended. Symantec Endpoint Protection cannot remove or clean the threat. Symantec Endpoint Protection can only block the threat.
25 = RepairFailedPowerEraser2. A Power Eraser scan is recommended. Symantec Endpoint Protection cannot remove or clean the threat. Symantec Endpoint Protection cannot confirm that it blocked the threat.
98 = Suspicious
99 = Details pending
100 = IDS block.
101 = Firewall violation.
102 = Allowed by user.
110 = Detected by using the commercial application list.
111 = Forced detection by using the file name.
200 = Attachment stripped.
1000 = Forced detection by using the file hash.
500 = Not applicable.

table.name: ADMINUSER
table.remarks: A list of reporting administrators.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The username of the administrator.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: A GUID the representing the currently logged-on domain.

column.name: AUTOREFRESH
column.remarks: The user-defined auto refresh value for all logs (events.php, alerts.php).

column.name: LASTCHANGE
column.remarks: The last time that the user accessed the console.

column.name: LASTSPMTIME
column.remarks: Last time for a successful keep-alive connection to the application server.

table.name: AGENT_BEHAVIOR_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps client activities that occur in agents.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the log belongs.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: GROUP_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the group to which the log belongs.

column.name: COMPUTER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the client computer associated with the agent log.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
An event ID from the sending agent:
501 = Application Control Driver
502 = Application Control Rules
999 = Tamper Protection

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
The seriousness of the event
0 is most serious.

column.name: AGENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent.

column.name: HARDWARE_KEY
column.remarks: The hash of the computer hardware information.

column.name: HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the client computer.

column.name: ACTION
column.remarks:
The action that was taken:
0 = allow
1 = block
2 = ask
3 = continue
4 = terminate

column.name: TEST_MODE
column.remarks:
Was this rule run in test mode?
0 = No, Else = Yes

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: The behavior that was blocked.

column.name: VAPI_NAME
column.remarks: The API that was blocked.

column.name: BEGIN_TIME
column.remarks: The start time of the security issue.

column.name: END_TIME
column.remarks: The end time of the security issue. This field is an optional field because the exact end time of traffic may not be detected; for example, as with UDP traffic. If the end time is not detected, it is set to equal the start time.

column.name: RULE_ID
column.remarks: The ID of the rule triggered by the event. It is always 0 if the rule ID is not specified in the security rule. The field is helpful to security rule troubleshooting. If multiple rules match, it logs the rule that has final decision on PacketProc (pass/block/drop).

column.name: RULE_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the rule that was triggered by the event. If the rule name is not specified in the security rule, then this field is empty. Having the rule name can be useful for troubleshooting. You may recognize a rule by the rule ID, but rule name can help you recognize it more quickly.

column.name: CALLER_PROCESS_ID
column.remarks: The ID of the process that triggers the logging.

column.name: CALLER_PROCESS_NAME
column.remarks: The full path name of the application involved. It may be empty if the application is unknown, or if OS itself is involved, or if no application is involved. Also, it may be empty if profile says, "don't log application name in raw traffic log".

column.name: CALLER_RETURN_ADDRESS
column.remarks: The return address of the caller. This field allows the detection of the calling module that makes the API call.

column.name: CALLER_RETURN_MODULE_NAME
column.remarks: The module name of the caller. See CallerReturnAddress for more information.

column.name: PARAMETER
column.remarks: Parameters that were used in the API call. Each parameter was converted to string format and separated by one space character. Double quotation mark characters within the string are escaped with a \ character.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks: Indicates whether this event is counted when the server processes alert notification. It is marked as true if the event is logged by Tamper Protection. It is false otherwise. (True = 1, False = 0)

column.name: SEND_SNMP_TRAP
column.remarks: Reflects the status of the send SNMP trap action. It is true if "send" is true.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The logon user name.

column.name: DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The logon (Windows) domain name.

column.name: REPETITION
column.remarks: Event repetition due to aggregation (damper).

column.name: LOG_IDX
column.remarks: Log index unique ID.

column.name: IP_ADDR
column.remarks: The IP address of the computer associated with the application control violation.

column.name: FILE_SIZE
column.remarks: The size of the file associated with the application control violation, in bytes.

column.name: ACTION_TYPE
column.remarks:
The violation type that triggered the SymProtect event.
Valid values are between 0 to 58, inclusive.

column.name: PARAM_DEVICE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of an external device (floppy disk, DVD, USB device, etc.).

table.name: AGENT_BEHAVIOR_LOG_2
table.remarks: Keeps client activities that occur in agents. The LOG_IDX field serves as the table's unique identifier, but it is not formally classified as the table's primary key. This field has an index on it, but it is not the primary key index. This table has no primary key.

The seriousness of the event
0 is most serious.

column.name: DESCRIPTION

column.name: VAPI_NAME
column.remarks: The API that was blocked.

column.name: BEGIN_TIME
column.remarks: The start time of the security issue.

column.name: END_TIME
column.remarks: The end time of the security issue. This field is an optional field because the exact end time of traffic may not be detected; for example, as with UDP traffic. If the end time is not detected, it is set to equal the start time.

column.name: RULE_ID
column.remarks: The ID of the rule that is triggered by the event. It is always 0 if the rule ID is not specified in the security rule. This field is helpful to security rule troubleshooting. If multiple rules match, it logs the rule that has the final decision on PacketProc (pass/block/drop).

column.name: RULE_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the rule that was triggered by the event. If the rule name is not specified in the security rule, then this field is empty. Having the rule name can be useful for troubleshooting. You may recognize a rule by the rule ID, but rule name can help you recognize it more quickly.

column.name: CALLER_PROCESS_ID
column.remarks: The ID of the process that triggers the logging.

column.name: CALLER_PROCESS_NAME
column.remarks: The full path name of the application involved. It may be empty if the application is unknown, or if OS itself is involved, or if no application is involved. Also, it may be empty if profile says, "don't log application name in raw traffic log".

column.name: CALLER_RETURN_ADDRESS
column.remarks: The return address of the caller. This field allows the detection of the calling module that makes the API call.

column.name: CALLER_RETURN_MODULE_NAME
column.remarks: Module name of caller. See CallerReturnAddress for more information.

column.name: PARAMETER
column.remarks: Parameters that were used in the API call. Each parameter was converted to STRING format and separated by one space character. Double quotation characters within the string are escape by a \ char.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks: Indicates whether this event is counted when the server processes alert notification. It is marked as true if the event is logged by Tamper Protection. It is false otherwise. (True = 1, False = 0)

column.name: SEND_SNMP_TRAP
column.remarks: It reflects the send SNMP trap action. It is true if send is true.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The logon user name.

column.name: DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The logon (Windows) domain name.

column.name: REPETITION
column.remarks: Event repetition due to aggregation (damper).

column.name: LOG_IDX
column.remarks: Log index unique ID.

column.name: IP_ADDR
column.remarks: The IP address of the computer associated with the application control violation.

column.name: FILE_SIZE
column.remarks: The size of the file associated with the application control violation, in bytes.

column.name: ACTION_TYPE
column.remarks:
Violation type that triggered the SymProtect event.
Valid values are 0 to 58 inclusive.

column.name: PARAM_DEVICE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of an external device (floppy disk, DVD, USB device, etc.).

table.name: AGENT_DEF_CACHE
table.remarks: Used to cache the current definition numbers used by agents for reporting.

column.name: IPS_DEF
column.remarks: IPS definition number used by the agent.

column.name: SONAR_DEF
column.remarks: SONAR definition number used by the agent.

column.name: MRCLEAN_DEF
column.remarks: Mr. Clean definition number used by the agent.

column.name: AV_DEF
column.remarks: AV definition number used by the agent.

column.name: REFRESH_TIME
column.remarks: The time when the table was refreshed by the background task.

column.name: REFRESH_USN
column.remarks: The Update Serial Number from when the table was refreshed by the background task.

table.name: AGENT_PACKET_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps packet traffic that occurs in agents.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the log belongs.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: GROUP_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the group to which the log belongs.

column.name: COMPUTER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the client computer that is associated with the agent packet log.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
An event ID from the sending agent:
401 = Raw Ethernet

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: AGENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent.

column.name: HARDWARE_KEY
column.remarks: The hash of the computer hardware information.

column.name: HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the client computer.

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the remote computer. This field may be empty if the name resolution failed.

column.name: LOCAL_PORT
column.remarks: The TCP/UDP port of the local computer (host byte-order). It is only valid on TSE_TRAFFIC_TCP and TSE_TRAFFIC_UDP. For other events, it is always zero.

column.name: REMOTE_PORT
column.remarks: The TCP/UDP port of the remote computer (host byte-order). It is only valid on TSE_TRAFFIC_TCP and TSE_TRAFFIC_UDP. For other events, it is always zero.

column.name: TRAFFIC_DIRECTION
column.remarks: The direction of traffic (unknown = 0; inbound = 1; outbound = 2). (Enum)

column.name: BLOCKED
column.remarks: Specifies if the traffic was blocked (yes = 1, no = 0).

column.name: APP_NAME
column.remarks: The full path name of the application involved. It may be empty if an unknown application is involved or if no application is involved. For example, the ping of death DoS attack does not have an AppName because it attacks the operating system.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks: Reflects the alert attribute in the profile for action. It is true if "action::alert" is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: SEND_SNMP_TRAP
column.remarks: It reflects the send SNMP trap action. It is true if send is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: EVENT_DATA
column.remarks: Additional data in binary format. This field is optional.

column.name: LOG_IDX
column.remarks: Log index unique ID.

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IPV6
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv6).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IPV6
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote host (IPv6).

column.name: RULE_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the rule that was triggered by the event. If the rule name is not specified in the security rule, then this field is empty. Having the rule name can be useful for troubleshooting. You may recognize a rule by the rule ID, but rule name can help you recognize it more quickly.

table.name: AGENT_SECURITY_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps security events that occur in agents.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the log belongs.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: GROUP_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the group to which the log belongs.

column.name: COMPUTER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the client computer that is associated with the agent security log.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
Compliance events:
209 = Host Integrity failed.
210 = Host Integrity passed.
221 = Host Integrity failed, but reported as PASS.
237 = Host Integrity custom log entry.
.
Firewall and IPS events:
207 = Active Response.
211 = Active Response was disengaged.
219 = Active Response was cancelled.
205 = Executable file was changed.
216 = Executable file change was detected.
217 = Executable file change was accepted.
218 = Executable file change was denied.
220 = Application hijacking.
201 = Invalid traffic by rule.
202 = Port Scan.
203 = Denial of Service.
204 = Trojan.
206 = Intrusion Prevention System Intrusion Detected.
208 = MAC spoofing.
249 = Browser Protection event.
.
Application and Device control:.
238 = Device control disabled device.
239 = Buffer Overflow Event.
240 = Software protection has thrown an exception.

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
The severity as defined in the security rule.
Critical = 0 - 3
Major = 4 - 7
Minor = 8 - 11
Info = 12 - 15

column.name: AGENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent.

column.name: HARDWARE_KEY
column.remarks: The hash of the computer hardware information.

column.name: HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the client computer.

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the remote computer. This field may be empty if the name resolution failed.

column.name: TRAFFIC_DIRECTION
column.remarks: The direction of traffic. (Unknown = 0; inbound = 1; outbound = 2)(Enum)

column.name: NETWORK_PROTOCOL
column.remarks: The protocol type. (OTHERS = 1; TCP = 2; UDP = 3; ICMP = 4)(Enum)

column.name: HACK_TYPE
column.remarks:
If event ID = 209, Host Integrity failed (TSLOG_SEC_NO_AV), the reason for the failure
If Event ID = 206, Intrusion Prevention System( Intrusion Detected, TSLOG_SEC_INTRUSION_DETECTED), the intrusion ID
If event ID = 210, Host Integrity passed( TSLOG_SEC_AV), additional information

Possible reasons are as follows:

Process is not running - Bit0 is 1
Signature is out of date - Bit1 is 1
Recovery was attempted - Bit2 is 1

column.name: BEGIN_TIME
column.remarks: The start time of the security issue.

column.name: END_TIME
column.remarks: The end time of the security issue. This field is an optional field because the exact end time of traffic may not be detected; for example, as with UDP traffic. If the end time is not detected, it is set to equal the start time.

column.name: REPETITION
column.remarks: The number of attacks. Sometime, when a hacker launches a mass attack, it may be reduced to one event by the log system, depending on the damper period.

column.name: APP_NAME
column.remarks: The full path of the application involved. This field may be empty if an unknown application is involved, or no application is involved. For example, the ping of death DoS attack does not have an application name because it attacks the OS itself.

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, the first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: EVENT_DATA
column.remarks: Additional data in binary format. This field is optional.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks: Reflects the alert attribute in the profile for action. It is true if "action::alert" is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: SEND_SNMP_TRAP
column.remarks: Reflects the send SNMP trap action. It is true if "send" is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_MAC
column.remarks: The MAC address of the local computer.

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_MAC
column.remarks: The MAC address of the remote computer.

column.name: LOCATION_NAME
column.remarks: The location used when the event occured.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The logon user name.

column.name: DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The logon domain name.

column.name: AGENT_SECURITY_LOG_IDX
column.remarks: The log index unique ID.

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IPV6
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv6).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IPV6
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote host (IPv6).

column.name: LOCAL_PORT
column.remarks: The local port.

column.name: REMOTE_PORT
column.remarks: The remote port.

column.name: CIDS_SIGN_ID
column.remarks: The signature ID.

column.name: STR_CIDS_SIGN_ID
column.remarks: The signature name.

column.name: CIDS_SIGN_SUB_ID
column.remarks: The signature sub ID.

column.name: INTRUSION_URL
column.remarks: The URL from the detection.

column.name: INTRUSION_PAYLOAD_URL
column.remarks: The URL that hosted the payload.

column.name: HI_EXECUTION_ID
column.remarks: The execution ID that the SNAC agent generates for each HI execution.

column.name: AGENT_VERSION
column.remarks: The agent version number on the client.

column.name: PROFILE_SERIAL_NO
column.remarks: The policy serial number.

Application and Device control:
238 = Device control disabled device
239 = Buffer Overflow Event
240 = Software protection has thrown an exception

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
The severity as defined in the security rule.
Critical = 0 - 3
Major = 4 - 7
Minor = 8 - 11
Info = 12 - 15

column.name: AGENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent.

column.name: HARDWARE_KEY
column.remarks: The hash of the computer hardware information.

column.name: HOST_NAME

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the remote computer. This field may be empty if the name resolution failed.

column.name: TRAFFIC_DIRECTION
column.remarks: The direction of traffic. (Unknown = 0; inbound = 1; outbound = 2)(Enum)

column.name: NETWORK_PROTOCOL
column.remarks: The protocol type. (OTHERS = 1; TCP = 2; UDP = 3; ICMP = 4)(Enum)

column.name: HACK_TYPE
column.remarks:
If the event ID is TSLOG_SEC_NO_AV, then it is one of the reasons listed below.
If the event ID is TSLOG_SEC_INTRUSION_DETECTED, it is intrusion ID.
If the event ID is TSLOG_SEC_AV, then it is additional information.

Reasons:

Bit0 is 1: Process is not running
Bit1 is 1: Signature is out of date
Bit2 is 1: Recovery was attempted

column.name: BEGIN_TIME
column.remarks: The start time of the security issue.

column.name: END_TIME
column.remarks: The end time of the security issue. This field is an optional field because the exact end time of traffic may not be detected; for example, as with UDP traffic. If the end time is not detected, it is set to equal the start time.

column.name: REPETITION
column.remarks: The number of attacks. Sometime, when a hacker launches a mass attack, it may be reduced to one event by the log system, depending on the damper period.

column.name: APP_NAME
column.remarks: The full path of the application involved. This field may be empty if an unknown application is involved, or no application is involved. For example, the ping of death DoS attack does not have an application name because it attacks the OS itself.

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, the first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: EVENT_DATA
column.remarks: Additional data in binary format. This field is optional.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks: Reflects the alert attribute in the profile for action. It is true if "action::alert" is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: SEND_SNMP_TRAP
column.remarks: Reflects the send SNMP trap action. It is true if "send" is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_MAC
column.remarks: The MAC address of the local computer.

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_MAC
column.remarks: The MAC address of the remote computer.

column.name: LOCATION_NAME
column.remarks: The location used when the event occured.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The logon user name.

column.name: DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The logon domain name.

column.name: AGENT_SECURITY_LOG_IDX
column.remarks: The log index unique ID.

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IPV6
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv6).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IPV6
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote host (IPv6).

column.name: LOCAL_PORT
column.remarks: The local port.

column.name: REMOTE_PORT
column.remarks: The remote port.

column.name: CIDS_SIGN_ID
column.remarks: The signature ID.

column.name: STR_CIDS_SIGN_ID
column.remarks: The signature name.

column.name: CIDS_SIGN_SUB_ID
column.remarks: The signature sub ID.

column.name: INTRUSION_URL
column.remarks: The URL from the detection.

column.name: INTRUSION_PAYLOAD_URL
column.remarks: The URL that hosted the payload.

column.name: HI_EXECUTION_ID
column.remarks: The execution ID that the SNAC agent generates for each HI execution.

column.name: AGENT_VERSION
column.remarks: The agent version number on the client.

column.name: PROFILE_SERIAL_NO
column.remarks: The policy serial number.

table.name: AGENT_SYSTEM_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps system traffic that occur in agents.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the log belongs.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: GROUP_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the group to which the log belongs.

column.name: COMPUTER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the client computer that is associated with the agent system log.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
An event ID from send agent

AGENT_SYSTEM_INSTALL_EVENT_TYPES = Installation events: possible values are
0x12070001 = Internal error
0x12070101 = Install complete
0x12070102 = Restart recommended
0x12070103 = Restart required
0x12070104 = Installation failed
0x12070105 = Uninstallation complete
0x12070106 = Uninstallation failed
0x12071037 = Symantec Endpoint Protection installed
0x12071038 = Symantec Firewall installed
0x12071039 = Uninstall
0x1207103A = Uninstall rolled-back

AGENT_SYSTEM_SERVICE_EVENT_TYPES = Service events: possible values are
0x12070201 = Service starting
0x12070202 = Service started
0x12070203 = Service start failure
0x12070204 = Service stopped,0x12070205=Service stop failure
0x1207021A = Attempt to stop service

AGENT_SYSTEM_CONFIG_EVENT_TYPES = Configuration events: possible values are
0x12070206 = Config import complete
0x12070207 = Config import error
0x12070208 = Config export complete
0x12070209 = Config export error

AGENT_SYSTEM_HI_EVENT_TYPES = Host Integrity events: possible values are
0x12070210 = Host Integrity disabled
0x12070211 = Host Integrity enabled
0x12070220 = NAP integration enabled

AGENT_SYSTEM_IMPORT_EVENT_TYPES = Import events: possible values are
0x12070214 = Successfully imported advanced rule
0x12070215 = Failed to import advanced rule
0x12070216 = Successfully exported advanced rule
0x12070217 = Failed to export advanced rule

AGENT_SYSTEM_CLIENT_EVENT_TYPES = Client events: possible values are
0x12070218 = Client Engine enabled
0x12070219 = Client Engine disabled
0x12071046 = Proactive Threat Scanning is not supported on this platform
0x12071047 = Proactive Threat Scanning Load Error

AGENT_SYSTEM_SERVER_EVENT_TYPES = Server events: possible values are
0x12070301 = Server connected
0x12070302 = No server response
0x12070303 = Server connection failed
0x12070304 = Server disconnected
0x120B0001 = Cannot reach server
0x120B0002 = Reconnected server

AGENT_SYSTEM_PROFILE_EVENT_TYPES = Policy events: possible values are
0x12070306 = New policy received
0x12070307 = New policy applied
0x12070308 = New policy failed
0x12070309 = Cannot download policy
0x120B0005 = Cannot download policy
0x1207030A = Have latest policy
0x120B0004 = Have latest policy

AGENT_SYSTEM_AV_EVENT_TYPES = Antivirus engine events: possible values are
0x12071006 = Scan Omission
0x1207100B = Virus Behavior Detected
0x1207100C = Configuration Changed
0x12071010 = Definition File Download
0x12071012 = Sent To Quarantine Server
0x12071013 = Delivered To Symantec
0x12071014 = Security Response Backup
0x12071015 = Scan Aborted
0x12071016 = Symantec Endpoint Protection Auto-Protect Load Error
0x12071017 = Symantec Endpoint Protection Auto-Protect Enabled
0x12071018 = Symantec Endpoint Protection Auto-Protect Disabled
0x1207101A = Scan Delayed
0x1207101B = Scan Re-started
0x12071027 = Symantec Endpoint Protection is using old virus definitions
0x12071041 = Scan suspended
0x12071042 = Scan Resumed
0x12071043 = Scan Duration Too Short
0x12071045 = Scan Enhancements Failed

AGENT_SYSTEM_LICENSE_EVENT_TYPES = License events: possible values are
0x1207101E = License Warning
0x1207101F = License Error
0x12071020 = License in Grace Period
0x12071023 = License Installed
0x12071025 = License Up-to-date

AGENT_SYSTEM_SECURITY_EVENT_TYPES = Security events: possible values are
0x1207102B = Computer not compliant with security policy
0x1207102C = Computer compliant with security policy
0x1207102D = Tamper Attempt

AGENT_SYSTEM_OTHER_EVENT_TYPES = Other events: possible values are
0x1207020A = Email post OK
0x1207020B = Email post failure
0x1207020C = Update complete
0x1207020D = Update failure
0x1207020E = Manual location change
0x1207020F = Location changed
0x12070212 = Old Rasdll detected
0x12070213 = Autoupdate postponed
0x12070305 = Mode changed
0x1207030B = Cannot apply HI script
0x12070500 = System message from device control
0x12070600 = System message from anti-buffer overflow driver
0x12071021 = Access Denied Warning
0x12071022 = Log Forwarding Error
0x12071044 = Client moved

column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks: The type of event. (0 = Info, 1 = Warning, 2 = Error, 3 = Fatal)

column.name: AGENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent.

column.name: HARDWARE_KEY
column.remarks: The hash of the computer hardware information.

column.name: HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the client computer.

column.name: CATEGORY
column.remarks: Not used at this time.

column.name: EVENT_SOURCE
column.remarks: The data source, such as NETPORT, NATSRV, etc.

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, the first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: EVENT_DATA
column.remarks: Additional data in binary format. This field is optional.

column.name: SEND_SNMP_TRAP
column.remarks: Reflects the send SNMP trap action. It is true if "send" is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: LOG_IDX
column.remarks: Log index unique ID.

table.name: AGENT_TRAFFIC_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps network traffic that occur in agents.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the log belongs.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: GROUP_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the group to which the log belongs.

column.name: COMPUTER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the client computer that is associated with the agent traffic log.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
An event ID from the sending agent:
301 = TCP initiated
302 = UDP datagram
303 = Ping request
304 = TCP completed
305 = Traffic (other)
306 = ICMP packet
307 = Ethernet packet
308 = IP packet

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
Severity as defined in the security rule.
Critical = 0 - 3
Major = 4 - 7
Minor = 8 - 11
Info = 12 - 15

column.name: AGENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent.

column.name: HARDWARE_KEY
column.remarks: The hash of the computer hardware information.

column.name: HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the client computer.

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The host name of the remote computer. This field may be empty if the name resolution failed.

column.name: NETWORK_PROTOCOL
column.remarks: The protocol type. (OTHERS = 1; TCP = 2; UDP = 3; ICMP = 4)(Enum)

column.name: LOCAL_PORT
column.remarks: The TCP/UDP port of the local computer (host byte-order). It is only valid on TSE_TRAFFIC_TCP and TSE_TRAFFIC_UDP. For other events, it is always zero.

column.name: REMOTE_PORT
column.remarks: The TCP/UDP port of the remote computer (host byte-order). It is only valid on TSE_TRAFFIC_TCP and TSE_TRAFFIC_UDP. For other events, it is always zero.

column.name: TRAFFIC_DIRECTION
column.remarks: The direction of traffic. (Unknown = 0; inbound = 1; outbound = 2)(Enum)

column.name: BEGIN_TIME
column.remarks: The start time of the security issue.

column.name: END_TIME
column.remarks: The end time of the security issue. This field is an optional field because the exact end time of traffic may not be detected; for example, as with UDP traffic. If the end time is not detected, it is set to equal the start time.

column.name: REPETITION
column.remarks: The number of attacks. Sometime, when a hacker launches a mass attack, it may be reduced to one event by the log system, depending on the damper period.

column.name: APP_NAME
column.remarks: The full path of application involved. It may be empty if an unknown application is involved or if no application is involved. For example, the ping of death DoS attack does not have AppName because it attacks the operating system itself.

column.name: BLOCKED
column.remarks: Specifies if the traffic was blocked. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: RULE_ID
column.remarks: The ID of the rule that is triggered by the event. It is always 0 if the rule ID is not specified in the security rule. This field is helpful to security rule troubleshooting. If multiple rules match, it logs the rule that has the final decision on PacketProc (pass/block/drop).

column.name: RULE_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the rule that was triggered by the event. If the rule name is not specified in the security rule, then this field is empty. Having the rule name can be useful for troubleshooting. You may recognize a rule by the rule ID, but rule name can help you recognize it more quickly.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks: Reflects the alert attribute in the profile for action. It is true if "action::alert" is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: SEND_SNMP_TRAP
column.remarks: Reflects the send SNMP trap action. It is true if "send" is true. (Yes = 1, no = 0)

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_MAC
column.remarks: The MAC address of the local computer.

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_MAC
column.remarks: The MAC address of the remote computer.

column.name: LOCATION_NAME
column.remarks: The location used when the event occured.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The logon user name.

column.name: DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The logon domain name.

column.name: LOG_IDX
column.remarks: Log index unique ID.

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IPV6
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv6).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IPV6
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote host (IPv6).

table.name: AGENTCONFIG
table.remarks: Not used.

column.name: ENABLED
column.remarks: If status checking for this agent type is enabled, then it is ON; if status checking is not enabled, then it is blank.

column.name: AGENTTYPE
column.remarks:
1 = LogSender
2 = ClientInventory
3 = LogReaderInventory
4 = LogReaderEvents
5 = NotificationAgent
6 = HistoryAgent
7 = VirusCategory
8 = DBmaint
9 = The backup
10 = DiskFull

column.name: REMOTEX
column.remarks: A value of 1 indicates this agent runs on a remote host; 0 indicates it is running locally on the SEP Reporter host itself.

column.name: WARNAFTER_VALUE
column.remarks: A period of time of agent inactivity, after which a warning is raised.

column.name: WARNAFTER_UNIT
column.remarks: Unit for time for Warnafter_Value, in minutes, hours, or days.

column.name: EMAIL
column.remarks: Comma-separated list of email addresses that receive a warning mail if an agent is considered inactive.

table.name: AGENTSTATUS
table.remarks: The status of SEPM server tasks.

column.name: AGENTTYPE
column.remarks:
Type of agent:
SAV 10.x
LogSender
ClientInventory
SAV 11.x
AgentSweepingTask (Database maintenance)
TopThreatsTask (Gathers top and latest threats information)
VirusCatTask (Gathers virus properties)
ThreatCatTask (Gathers risk properties)

column.name: AGENTNAME
column.remarks: Name associated with this agent (for LogSender agents: Server Group name; for LogSenderSAVSMTP agents: mail gateway host name; for ClientInventory agents: name of Parent Server; else: blank)

column.name: LASTRUNGMT
column.remarks: The last time that this agent ran (GMT).

column.name: REMOTE_TZ_OFFSET
column.remarks: Time zone offset

column.name: REPORTER_TZ_OFFSET
column.remarks: Time zone offset of the reporter.

column.name: MAIL
column.remarks: Flag indicating whether email has already been sent (1 = yes, 0 = no).

column.name: VERSION_BUILD
column.remarks: The version/build (major.minor.build) of the agent.

column.name: MACHINE_NAME
column.remarks: The computer name of the client computer.

column.name: SERVERGROUP_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table IDENTITY_MAP.

column.name: LASTRUN_DATA
column.remarks: Extra data associated with the agent that ran, if any.

table.name: ALERTFILTER

column.name: USER_ID

column.name: FILTERNAME

column.name: STARTDATEFROM
column.remarks: The start date.

column.name: STARTDATETO
column.remarks: The end date.

column.name: RELATIVEDATETYPE
column.remarks:
0 = past week
1 = past month
2 = past three months
3 = past year
4 = past 24 hours
5 = current month

column.name: FILTERACKNOWLEDGED
column.remarks:
1 = Acknowledged
0 = Unacknowledged

column.name: FILTERSUBJECT
column.remarks:
AF = Authentication failure
CL = The client list changed
CS = Client security alert
ED = Enforcer down
WL = Forced or commercial application detected
LA = New learned application
NV = New risk detected
NS = New software package
VO = Virus outbreak
DF = Server health
1V = Single risk event
SE = System event
UM = Unmanaged computer
ID = Virus definitions are out-of-date

column.name: FILTERCREATEDBY
column.remarks: The GUID of the administrator who created any alert filters.

column.name: SERVERGROUP
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: CLIENTGROUP
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: PARENTSERVER
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: COMPUTER
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: THREATNAME
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: THREATCATEGORY
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: SOURCE
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: ACTUALACTION
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: LIMITROWS
column.remarks: The number of rows to use for pagination.

column.name: USERELATIVE
column.remarks: Use relative dates ('on'), or absolute dates.

column.name: REPORTINPUTS
column.remarks: Special parameters, if the report needs them.

column.name: NOTIFICATIONNAME
column.remarks: The name of the selected notification condition.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = not deleted, 1 = deleted

table.name: ALERTMSG
table.remarks: Lists and defines the meanings of the events possible for the Risk and Proactive Threat Protection (TruScan) log.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks:
This is a hard-coded English string that is used as a look-up, corresponding to an event ID from the sender agent as follows:
1 = Virus found
2 = Security risk found
3 = not used
4 = not used
5 = Commercial application detected
6 = Forced proactive threat detected
7 = Proactive detection now permitted
8 = Potential risk found
9 = Risk sample submitted to Symantec

table.name: ALERTS
table.remarks: Keeps the risk and Proactive Threat Protection (TruScan) events.

column.name: ALERT_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to table ALERTMSG

column.name: COMPUTER_IDX
column.remarks: The foreign key to SEM_COMPUTER.COMPUTER_ID.

column.name: SOURCE
column.remarks:
Hard-coded English string that is used as a lookup key for scan types:
"Scheduled Scan"
"Manual Scan"
"Real-Time Scan"
"Integrity Shield"
"Definition downloader"
"System"
"Startup Scan"
"DefWatch"
"Manual Quarantine"
"Reboot Processing"
"Heuristic Scan"

column.name: VIRUSNAME_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table VIRUS.

column.name: NOOFVIRUSES
column.remarks: Number of events for aggregated event record. This can be due to client-side aggregation, server-side compression, or both.

column.name: FILEPATH
column.remarks: The file path of the attacked file.

column.name: ACTUALACTION_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table ACTUALACTION; this is the action taken on the risk.

column.name: REQUESTEDACTION_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table ACTUALACTION; this is the action requested by the policy.

column.name: SECONDARYACTION_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table ACTUALACTION; this is the secondary action requested by the policy.

column.name: ALERTDATETIME
column.remarks: The time that the event occurred.

column.name: ALERTINSERTTIME
column.remarks: The time that the event was inserted into the database.

column.name: SERVERGROUP_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table IDENTITY_MAP; this is the SEPM domain GUID.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The user that was logged into the computer when the event took place.

column.name: PARENTSERVER_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table IDENTITY_MAP; this is the SEPM server GUID.

column.name: CLIENTGROUP_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table IDENTITY_MAP; this is the SEPM group GUID.

column.name: SOURCE_COMPUTER_NAME
column.remarks: This is the source of the threat. This is logged when Risk Tracer is enabled in the Virus and Spyware Protection policy.

column.name: SOURCE_COMPUTER_IP
column.remarks: This is the source of the threat. This is logged when Risk Tracer is enabled in the Virus and Spyware Protection policy.

column.name: MOTHER_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the related compressed event in the ALERTS table. This is the compressed event created by database maintenance. A value here means this event has been aggregated on the server-side and is a child event.

column.name: LAST_LOG_SESSION_GUID
column.remarks: This is an ID used by the client to keep track of related threat events.

column.name: ALERTENDDATETIME
column.remarks: Time at which event ended. This is the end of the aggregated event time.

column.name: HPP_APP_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table HPP_APPLICATION.

column.name: SITE_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table IDENTITY_MAP; this is the SEPM site GUID.

column.name: VBIN_ID
column.remarks: Client-side ID of the quarantined threat, if quarantined.

column.name: SCAN_ID
column.remarks: Pointer to the scan table event that picked up this event.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system or updated in the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = not deleted, 1 = deleted

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the local host.

column.name: AV_PRODUCT
column.remarks: The antivirus product name.

column.name: AV_PRODUCT_VERSION
column.remarks: Antivirus product version.

column.name: STATUS

column.name: TIME_STAMP

column.name: ADMIN_ID

column.name: IP_ADDR

column.remarks:

table.name: COMMAND
table.remarks: Keeps the Command status for agents.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The domain ID that was currently being administered when the command was created.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: BEGIN_TIME
column.remarks: The time that the command launched on the client (GMT).

column.name: LAST_UPDATE_TIME
column.remarks: The time that the client last reported its status (GMT).

column.name: STATE_ID
column.remarks:
Command status: a numeric value corresponding to one of the following:
0 = INITIAL
1 = RECEIVED
2 = IN_PROGRESS
3 = COMPLETED
4 = REJECTED
5 = CANCELLED
6 = ERROR

When first created, command status = INITIAL. It indicates that the endpoint has not received it yet.

column.name: SUB_STATE_ID
column.remarks:
Command-specific status:
-1 = Unknown
0 = Success
1 = Client did not execute the command
2 = Client did not report any status
3 = Command was a duplicate and was not executed
4 = Spooled command could not restart
5 = Restart command not allowed from the console
6 = Unexpected error
100 = Success
101 = Security risk found
102 = Scan was suspended
103 = Scan was aborted
105 = Scan did not return status
106 = Scan failed to start
110 = Auto-Protect could not be turned on
120 = LiveUpdate download is in progress
121 = LiveUpdate download failed
131 = Quarantine delete failed
132 = Quarantine delete partial success

column.name: SUB_STATE_DESC
column.remarks: Command-specific extra information, such as number of files scanned, or error messages.

column.name: ESTIMATED_DURATION
column.remarks: Agent estimation of command duration in minutes. 0 = no estimate or negligible time.

column.name: PERCENT_COMPLETE
column.remarks: Progress (0-100%) of command, based on estimated duration.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the command is added into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

table.name: COMMAND_REPORT
table.remarks: Keeps the administrator-defined filters for the Command details log.

column.name: STARTDATEFROM
column.remarks: The start time of the command.

column.name: STARTDATETO
column.remarks: The end time of the command.

column.name: RELATIVEDATETYPE
column.remarks:
0 = The past week.
1 = The past month.
2 = The past three months.
3 = The past year.
4 = The past 24 hours.
5 = The current month.

column.name: STATE_ID
column.remarks:
Command status
0 = Not received
1 = Received
2 = In progress
3 = Completed
4 = Rejected
5 = Canceled
6 = Error

column.name: SUB_STATE_ID
column.remarks:
Command-specific status:
-1 = Unknown
0 = Success
1 = Client did not execute the command
2 = Client did not report any status
3 = Command was a duplicate and was not executed
4 = Spooled command could not restart
5 = Restart command not allowed from the console
6 = Unexpected error
100 = Success
101 = Security risk found
102 = Scan was suspended
103 = Scan was aborted
105 = Scan did not return status
106 = Scan failed to start
110 = Auto-Protect could not be turned on
120 = LiveUpdate download is in progress
121 = LiveUpdate download failed
131 = Quarantine delete failed
132 = Quarantine delete partial success

column.name: PERCENT_COMPLETE
column.remarks: The progress of the command.

column.name: COMPUTERLIST
column.remarks: Command separated, wild-carded list of computer names to filter.

column.name: SORTORDER
column.remarks: The table column by which to sort.

column.name: SORTDIR
column.remarks: DESC = Descending order, ASC = Ascending order

column.name: LIMITROWS
column.remarks: The number of rows to use for pagination.

column.name: USERELATIVE
column.remarks: Use relative dates ('on'), or absolute dates.

column.name: REPORT_IDX
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: REPORTINPUTS
column.remarks: Special parameters, if the report needs them.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted rows; 0 = not deleted, 1 = deleted.

table.name: COMPLIANCE_REPORT
table.remarks: Keeps the administrator-defined filters for the Device Control log, the NTP Attacks log, and all the Compliance logs.

column.name: STARTDATEFROM
column.remarks: The start date.

column.name: STARTDATETO
column.remarks: The end date.

column.name: RELATIVEDATETYPE
column.remarks:
0 = The past week.
1 = The past month.
2 = The past three months.
3 = The past year.
4 = The past 24 hours.
5 = The current month.

column.name: COMPLIANCE_TYPE
column.remarks:
1 = Enforcer Server
2 = Enforcer Client
3 = Enforcer Traffic
4 = Host Compliance
5 = Attack (Firewall logs)
6 = Device Control

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
1 = Critical (which filters on SEVERITY >= 0 AND SEVERITY <= 3)
5 = Major (which filters on SEVERITY >= 4 AND SEVERITY <= 7)
9 = Minor (which filters on SEVERITY >= 8 AND SEVERITY <= 11)
13 = Info (which filters on SEVERITY >= 12 AND SEVERITY <= 15)

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
Events for Enforcer Server:
1 = Enforcer registered
2 = Enforcer failed to register
5 = Enforcer downloaded policy
7 = Enforcer downloaded sylink.xml
9 = Server received Enforcer log
12 = Server received Enforcer information
Events for Enforcer Traffic :
17 = Incoming traffic blocked
18 = Outgoing traffic blocked
33 = Incoming traffic allowed
34 = Outgoing traffic allowed
Events for Host compliance:
209 = Host Integrity failed
210 = Host Integrity passed
221 = Host Integrity failed but reported as PASS
237 = Host Integrity custom log entry
Events for Attack (firewall):
207 = Active Response
211 = Active Response disengaged
219 = Active Response canceled
217 = Executable file change accepted
218 = Executable file change denied
220 = Application Hijack
201 = N/A (invalid traffic by rule)
202 = Port Scan
203 = Denial of Service
204 = Trojan
206 = Intrusion Prevention
208 = MAC Spoofing
Events for Device control:
238 = Device control disabled device

column.name: BLOCKED
column.remarks: 0 = Blocked, 1 = Not Blocked

column.name: NETWORK_PROTOCOL
column.remarks: 1 = Other, 2 = TCP, 3 = UDP, 4 = ICMP

column.name: TRAFFIC_DIRECTION
column.remarks: 1 = Inbound, 2 = Outbound, 0 = Unknown

column.name: SERVERGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded domain names by which to filter.

column.name: CLIENTGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded group names by which to filter.

column.name: PARENTSERVERLIST
column.remarks: The comma-separated, wild-carded server names by which to filter.

column.name: COMPUTERLIST
column.remarks: Comma separate, wild-carded computer names by which to filter.

column.name: IPADDRESSLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded IP list by which to filter.

column.name: USERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded user names by which to filter.

column.name: SITELIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded site names by which to filter.

column.name: ENFORCERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded Enforcer names by which to filter.

column.name: REMOTEHOSTLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded remote computer names by which to filter.

column.name: REMOTEIPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded remote IP list by which to filter.

column.name: LOCAL_PORT
column.remarks: The local port number.

column.name: HACK_TYPE
column.remarks:
0 = Process is not running
1 = Signature is out-of-date
2 = Recovery was attempted

column.name: ACTION
column.remarks: For Enforcer Client: Authenticated, Disconnected, Passed, Rejected, Failed

column.name: ENFORCER_TYPE
column.remarks: For Enforcer Client: 0 = Gateway Enforcer, 1 = LAN Enforcer, 2 = DHCP Enforcer, 3 = Integrated Enforcer, 4 = NAP Enforcer, 5 = Peer-To-Peer Enforcer

column.name: OS_TYPE
column.remarks:
600 = Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008
502 = Windows 2003 and Windows XP 64 bit
501 = Windows XP
500 = Windows 2000
400 = Windows NT
000 = Other

column.name: SORTORDER
column.remarks: The column name in the log by which to sort.

column.name: SORTDIR
column.remarks: DESC = Descending, ASC = Ascending

column.name: LIMITROWS
column.remarks: The number of rows to use for pagination.

column.name: USERELATIVE
column.remarks: Use relative dates ('on'), or absolute dates.

column.name: REPORT_IDX
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: REPORTINPUTS
column.remarks: Special parameters, if the report needs them.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: Time that the record was modified

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted entry; 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted

column.name: FULL_CHARTS
column.remarks: The administrator-specified list of charts to include in the Network Threat Protection full report.

column.name: LOCAL_IP_ADDRESS
column.remarks: The local IP address.

column.name: APP_NAME
column.remarks: The application name.

column.name: LOCATION_NAME
column.remarks: The location name.

column.name: PROFILE_SERIAL_NO
column.remarks: The profile's serial number.

The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

column.remarks: The server's ID.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID

column.name: AGENT_ID

column.name: CLIENT_IP

column.name: CLIENT_PRODUCT_VERSION
column.remarks: The client's product version.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: REASON_CODE
column.remarks:
0 = Reason unknown
1 = Delta files are corrupted
2 = Size of delta file is invalid
3 = Delta creation request to Tomcat failed
4 = Client did not send source sequence number
5 = Source revision sent by client did not exist on server
6 = Tomcat hinted to skip delta generation
7 = Server did not find clients' closest matches
8 = Client did not support XDelta

table.name: DATA_HANDLER
table.remarks: Keeps the list of registered log handlers.

column.name: TECH_ID
column.remarks: The technology extension. Possible values are AvMan, LuMan, legacy, and SEP.

column.name: LF_EXT
column.remarks: File Extension. Possible values are .dat, .AgentStatus, .SecurityRisk, .VirusScans, .VirusLogs, and .Inventory.

column.name: LF_SORT
column.remarks: How files are sorted. Possible values: 0 = Ascending by file modification time, 1 = Descending by file modification time.

column.name: LF_HANDLER
column.remarks:
Classes that handle data files:
AvMan = com.sygate.scm.server.logreader.av.LogHandler
Legacy agentstatus = com.sygate.scm.server.logreader.av.AgentStatusHandler
Legacy inventory = com.sygate.scm.server.logreader.av.InventoryHandler
Legacy security and virus logs = com.sygate.scm.server.logreader.av.LogHandler

column.name: STATE_HANDLER
column.remarks:
Classes that handle state files:
SEP = com.sygate.scm.server.statereader.sep.StateHandler
AvMan = com.sygate.scm.server.statereader.av.StateHandler
LuMan = com.sygate.scm.server.statereader.lu.StateHandler

table.name: ENFORCER_CLIENT_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps client activities that occur in Enforcers.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks: No event IDs defined (logged as 0).

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: ENFORCER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the Enforcer.

column.name: ENFORCER_TYPE
column.remarks:
0 = Gateway Enforcer
1 = LAN Enforcer
2 = DHCP Enforcer
3 = Integrated Enforcer
4 = NAP Enforcer
5 = Peer-To-Peer Enforcer

column.name: CLIENT_ID
column.remarks: Not used (logged as '').

column.name: REMOTE_HOST
column.remarks: The remote host's name.

column.name: ACTION
column.remarks:
The Enforcer's action on the client (a hard-coded English string that is used as lookup)

Authenticated = Agent's UID is correct
Rejected = Agent's UID is wrong or there's no agent running
Disconnected = Agent disconnects from Enforcer or Enforcer service stops
Passed = Agent has passed Host Integrity check
Failed = Agent has failed Host Integrity check

column.name: PERIOD
column.remarks: The period in seconds that the Enforcer will take action on the client. Only valid when action is equal to Rejected and Disconnected. For other actions, this field must be 0.

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_MAC
column.remarks: The remote host's MAC address.

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_INFO
column.remarks: Remote host information.

column.name: RESERVED_VARCHAR1
column.remarks: For Peer-To-Peer Enforcer log records, this field contains the host name of the client acting as the Enforcer.

column.name: HI_EXECUTION_ID
column.remarks: The execution ID that the SNAC agent generates for each HI execution.

column.name: HI_STATUS
column.remarks: The Host Integrity Status of the SNAC agent.

column.name: UID_STATUS
column.remarks: Indicates UID status, whether Authenticated, Failed, etc.

column.name: POLICY_STATUS
column.remarks: Policy Status, such as Passed, Failed, Unknown, etc.

column.name: RADIUS_STATUS
column.remarks: The status of the RADIUS server.

table.name: ENFORCER_SYSTEM_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps client system activities that occur in Enforcers.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
An event ID from the sending agent: (in hex)
0x101 = Connected to management server
0x102 = Lost connection to management server
0x103 = Applied policy downloaded from management server
0x104 = Failed to apply policy downloaded from management server
0x105 = Applied management server configuration
0x106 = Failed to apply management server configuration
0x107 = Applied management server configuration
0x108 = Failed to apply management server configuration
0x110 = Registered to NAP management server
0x111 = Unregistered from NAP management server
0x112 = Failed to register to NAP management server
0x201 = Enforcer started
0x202 = Enforcer stopped
0x203 = Enforcer paused
0x204 = Enforcer resumed
0x205 = Enforcer disconnected from server
0x301 = Enforcer failover enabled
0x302 = Enforcer failover disabled
0x303 = Enforcer in standby mode
0x304 = Enforcer in primary mode
0x305 = Enforcer short
0x306 = Enforcer loop
0x401 = Forward engine pause
0x402 = Forward engine start
0x403 = DNS Enforcer enabled
0x404 = DNS Enforcer disabled
0x405 = DHCP Enforcer enabled
0x406 = DHCP Enforcer disabled
0x407 = Allow all enabled
0x408 = Allow all disabled
0x501 = Seat number change
0x601 = Failed to create policy parser
0x602 = Failed to import policy downloaded from management server
0x603 = Failed to export policy downloaded from management server
0x701 = Incorrect customized attribute

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: ENFORCER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the Enforcer.

column.name: ENFORCER_TYPE
column.remarks:
0 = Gateway Enforcer
1 = LAN Enforcer
2 = DHCP Enforcer
3 = Integrated Enforcer
4 = NAP Enforcer
5 = Peer-To-Peer Enforcer

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
The type of event. Possible values are:
0 = INFO
1 = WARNING
2 = ERROR
3 = FATAL

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, the first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: LOG_IDX
column.remarks: Log index unique ID.

table.name: ENFORCER_TRAFFIC_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps client traffic activities that occur in Enforcers.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
An event ID from send agent:
17 = Incoming traffic blocked
18 = Outgoing traffic blocked
33 = Incoming traffic allowed
34 = Outgoing traffic allowed

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: ENFORCER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the Enforcer.

column.name: ENFORCER_TYPE
column.remarks:
0 = Gateway Enforcer
1 = LAN Enforcer
2 = DHCP Enforcer
3 = Integrated Enforcer
4 = NAP Enforcer
5 = Peer-To-Peer Enforcer

column.name: CLIENT_ID
column.remarks: Not used (logged as '').

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote computer (IPv4).

column.name: NETWORK_PROTOCOL
column.remarks: The protocol type: Enum (OTHERS = 1; TCP = 2; UDP = 3; ICMP = 4)

column.name: LOCAL_PORT
column.remarks: The TCP/UDP port on the local computer (host byte-order). It is only valid on TSE_TRAFFIC_TCP and TSE_TRAFFIC_UDP. For other events, it is always zero.

column.name: REMOTE_PORT
column.remarks: The TCP/UDP port of the remote computer (host byte-order). It is only valid on TSE_TRAFFIC_TCP and TSE_TRAFFIC_UDP. For other events, it is always zero.

column.name: TRAFFIC_DIRECTION
column.remarks: The direction of traffic (unknown = 0; inbound = 1; outbound = 2). (Enum)

column.name: BEGIN_TIME
column.remarks: The start time of the Enforcer event.

column.name: END_TIME
column.remarks: The end time of the Enforcer event.

column.name: BLOCKED
column.remarks: Specify if the traffic was blocked. (0 = blocked, 1 = Not blocked ** note the difference in values between this and the AGENT_TRAFFIC_LOG_x tables)

column.name: TOTAL_BYTES
column.remarks: The total length of all of the packets in the traffic.

column.name: REPETITION
column.remarks: The number of attacks. Sometime, when a hacker launches a mass attack, it may be reduced to one event by the log system, depending on the damper period.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks: Reflects the alert attribute in the profile for action. It is true if "action::alert" is true.

34 = Outgoing traffic allowed

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The time of the generated event (GMT).

column.name: ENFORCER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the Enforcer.

column.name: ENFORCER_TYPE
column.remarks:
0 = Gateway Enforcer
1 = LAN Enforcer
2 = DHCP Enforcer
3 = Integrated Enforcer
4 = NAP Enforcer
5 = Peer-To-Peer Enforcer

column.name: CLIENT_ID
column.remarks: Not used (logged as '').

column.name: LOCAL_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the local computer (IPv4).

column.name: REMOTE_HOST_IP
column.remarks: The IP address of the remote computer (IPv4).

column.name: NETWORK_PROTOCOL
column.remarks: The protocol type: Enum (OTHERS = 1; TCP = 2; UDP = 3; ICMP = 4)

column.name: LOCAL_PORT
column.remarks: The TCP/UDP port on the local computer (host byte-order). It is only valid on TSE_TRAFFIC_TCP and TSE_TRAFFIC_UDP. For other events, it is always zero.

column.name: REMOTE_PORT
column.remarks: The TCP/UDP port of the remote computer (host byte-order). It is only valid on TSE_TRAFFIC_TCP and TSE_TRAFFIC_UDP. For other events, it is always zero.

column.name: TRAFFIC_DIRECTION
column.remarks: The direction of traffic (unknown = 0; inbound = 1; outbound = 2). (Enum)

column.name: BEGIN_TIME
column.remarks: The start time of the Enforcer event.

column.name: END_TIME
column.remarks: The end time of the Enforcer event.

column.name: BLOCKED
column.remarks: Specify if the traffic was blocked. (0 = blocked, 1 = Not blocked ** note the difference in values between this and the AGENT_TRAFFIC_LOG_x tables)

column.name: TOTAL_BYTES
column.remarks: The total length of all of the packets in the traffic.

column.name: REPETITION
column.remarks: The number of attacks. Sometime, when a hacker launches a mass attack, it may be reduced to one event by the log system, depending on the damper period.

column.name: ALERT
column.remarks: Reflects the alert attribute in the profile for action. It is true if "action::alert" is true.

table.name: ENROLMENT_JOB_STATUS
table.remarks: Holds submitted enrollment job-related statuses for bulk updating device information in batches. Enroll job updates 'Hardware Key', 'Device Id', 'Public Key', 'Device Info' to help enabling communication between ATP, SEPM, SEP (EDR).

column.name: JOB_STATUS
column.remarks: The job's status (Processing, Completed).

column.name: SUCCESS_COUNT
column.remarks: The number of devices that updated successfully.

column.name: FAIL_COUNT
column.remarks: The number of devices that did not update successfully.

column.name: TOTAL_COUNT
column.remarks: The total number of devices included in the enrollment request.

column.name: JOB_REQUEST_TIME
column.remarks: The time that the Endpoint Protection Manager server received the request.

column.name: ROW_LAST_UPDATED
column.remarks: The time that the Endpoint Protection Manager server updated the last batch rows, and modified this table's status.

table.name: ENUM_MAP
table.remarks: For internal use only. Supports the automation of internal processes.

table.name: FIREWALL_REPORT
table.remarks: Keeps the administrator-defined filters for the NTP Traffic and Packet logs.

column.name: USER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the user who created this filter.

column.name: FILTERNAME
column.remarks: The filter name.

column.name: STARTDATEFROM
column.remarks: The start date.

column.name: STARTDATETO
column.remarks: The end date.

column.name: RELATIVEDATETYPE
column.remarks:
0 = The past week.
1 = The past month.
2 = The past three months.
3 = The past year.
4 = The past 24 hours.
5 = The current month.

column.name: FIREWALLTYPE
column.remarks: 1 = Traffic, 2 = Packets

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks: 1 = Critical, 5 = Major, 9 = Minor, 13 = Info

column.name: EVENTTYPE
column.remarks:
Events for Traffic :
307 = Ethernet packet,
306 = ICMP packet,
308 = IP packet,
303 = Ping request,
301 = TCP initiated,
304 = TCP completed,
302 = UDP datagram,
305 = Other
Events for Packet:
401 = Raw Ethernet

column.name: BLOCKED
column.remarks: 1 = Blocked, 0 = Not blocked

column.name: PROTOCOL
column.remarks: 1 = Other, 2 = TCP, 3 = UDP, 4 = ICMP

column.name: DIRECTION
column.remarks: The direction of traffic. 1 = Inbound, 2 = Outbound, 0 = Unknown

column.name: LOCALPORT
column.remarks: The local port number.

column.name: SITELIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded site names by which to filter.

column.name: SERVERGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded domain names by which to filter.

column.name: CLIENTGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded group names by which to filter.

column.name: PARENTSERVERLIST
column.remarks: The comma-separated, wild-carded server names by which to filter.

column.name: COMPUTERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded computer names by which to filter.

column.name: IPADDRESSLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded IP list by which to filter.

column.name: REMOTEHOSTLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded remote computer names by which to filter.

column.name: REMOTEIPADDRLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded remote IP list by which to filter.

column.name: USERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded user names by which to filter.

column.name: SORTORDER
column.remarks: The table column by which to sort.

column.name: SORTDIR
column.remarks: DESC = Descending, ASC = Ascending

column.name: LIMITROWS
column.remarks: The number of rows to use for pagination.

column.name: USERELATIVE
column.remarks: Use relative dates ('on'), or absolute dates.

column.name: REPORT_IDX
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: REPORTINPUTS
column.remarks: Special parameters, if the report needs them.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Delete row; 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted

column.name: FULL_CHARTS
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: LOCAL_IP_ADDRESS
column.remarks: The local IP address.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The domain name that the group belongs to.

column.name: HI_ENABLED
column.remarks: Is Host Integrity enabled?

column.remarks: Pointer to the table HISTORYCONFIG.

column.name: EVENT_DATETIME
column.remarks: Snapshot time (in GMT).

column.name: STAT_TYPE
column.remarks:
What kind of data; a hard-coded English key.

Examples:

Report: Percentage of clients failing Host Integrity check over time (all)

Stat_Type: PercentHIFail
Target:
Statistic: Percentage number

Stat_Type: ztaPercentHIFail
Target:
Statistic: Total agent count

Report: Percentage of clients failing Host Integrity check over Time (by top 10 groups)

Stat_Type: PercentHIFailGroup
Target: Group GUID
Statistic: Percentage of group

Stat_Type: ztaPercentHIFailGroup
Target: Group GUID
Statistic: Total agents in group

Report: Percentage of clients failing Host Integrity check over time (by top 10 OS)

Stat_Type: PercentHIFailOS
Target: OS ID number
Statistic: Percentage of OS total

Stat_Type: ztaPercentHIFailOS
Target: OS ID number
Statistic: Total agents with OS

Report: Software packages rollout

Stat_Type: SoftwareRollout
Target: Agent version
Statistic: Agent count

Report: Number of computers online/offline over time

Target:
Statistic: Agent count online

Stat_Type: OfflineAgents
Target:
Statistic: Agent count offline

Stat_Type: zta
Target:
Statistic: Agent count total

Stat_Type: ztaOnlineAgentsGroup
Target: Group GUID
Statistic: Agent count in group

Statistic: Agent count with OS

Statistic: Agent count by OS

table.name: HISTORYCONFIG
table.remarks: Keeps scheduled report configuration information

column.name: USER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the user who created the scheduled report.

column.name: TZ_OFFSET
column.remarks: The time zone offset from when the administrator created the scheduled report, so that the data is formatted for the administrator's local time zone.

column.name: FILTERNAME
column.remarks: The filter used by the scheduled report.

column.name: REPORT_IDX
column.remarks:
Format is Reporttype-number: example I-0 is Virus Definitions Distribution

I = Computer Status Report
0 = Virus Definitions Distribution
1 = Computers Not Checked Into Server
2 = Symantec Endpoint Protection Product Versions
3 = Intrusion Prevention Signature Distribution
4 = Client Inventory
5 = Compliance Status Distribution
6 = Client Online Status
7 = Clients With Latest Policy
8 = Client Count by Group
9 = Security Status Summary
10 = Protection Content Versions
11 =Client Migration
100 = Client Software Rollout (Snapshots)
101 = Clients Online/Offline Over Time (Snapshots)
102 = Clients With Latest Policy Over Time (Snapshots)
103 = Non-Compliant Clients Over Time (Snapshots)
104 = Virus Definition Rollout (Snapshots)

A = Audit Report
0 = Policies Used

B = Application and Device Control Report
0 = Top Groups With Most Alerted Application Control Logs
1 = Top Targets Blocked
2 = Top Devices Blocked


C = Compliance Report
0 = Network Compliance Status
1 = Compliance Status
2 = Clients by Compliance Failure Summary
3 = Compliance Failure Details
4 = Non-compliant Clients by Location

F = Network Threat Protection Report
0 = Top Targets Attacked
1 = Top Sources of Attack
2 = Top Types of Attack
3 = Top Blocked Applications
4 = Attacks Over Time
5 = Security Events by Severity
6 = Blocked Applications Over Time
7 = Traffic Notifications Over Time
8 = Top Traffic Notifications
9 = Full Report

R = Risk Report
0 = Infected and At Risk Computers
1 = Detection Action Summary
2 = Risk Detections Count
3 = New Risks Detected in the Network
4 = Top Risk Detections Correlation
5 = Risk Distribution Summary
6 = Risk Distribution Over Time
8 = Proactive Threat Detection Results
9 = Proactive Threat Distribution
10 = Proactive Threat Detection Over Time
11 = Action Summary for Top Risks
12 = Number of Notifications
14 = Number of Notifications Over Time
13 = Weekly Outbreaks
7 = Comprehensive Risk Report

S = Scan Report
0 = Scan Statistics Histogram
1 = Computers by Last Scan Time
2 = Computers Not Scanned

Y = System Report
0 = Top Clients That Generate Errors
1 = Top Servers That Generate Errors
2 = Top Enforcers That Generate Errors
3 = Database Replication Failures Over Time
4 =Site Status Report

column.name: STARTTIME
column.remarks: When to start generating the report. This establishes its scheduled time within the repeat schedule.

column.name: LASTRUN
column.remarks: The last time that the report was generated (in GMT).

column.name: RUNHOURS
column.remarks:
Repeat the schedule for this report:
1 = Every 1 hour
24 = Every 1 day
168 = Every week
720 = Every month

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: The name of the scheduled report.

column.name: EMAIL
column.remarks: The comma-separated list of email addresses to which the report is sent.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: The administrator-provided description for the report.

column.name: DISABLED
column.remarks: Scheduled report disabled: 0 = No, 1 = Yes

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted.

column.name: IS_MAIL_TO_SYS_ADMIN
column.remarks: The flag for mailing to be sent to system administrator.

column.name: FILTER_USER_ID
column.remarks: Filter user ID

column.name: TZ_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the time zone in which the administrator created the notification, so that emailed reports can display dates in the administrator's local time zone.

table.name: HOMEPAGECONFIG
table.remarks: Keeps administrator-specific preferences.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The administrator's GUID.

column.name: PARAMETER
column.remarks: The parameter name.

column.name: VALUE
column.remarks: The parameter value.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row; 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted

table.name: HPP_ALERTS
table.remarks: Keeps Proactive Threat Protection (TruScan) event information.

column.name: SENSITIVITY
column.remarks: The engine sensitivity setting that produced the detection (0...100)

column.name: DETECTION_SCORE
column.remarks: The score of the detection (0...100)

column.name: COH_ENGINE_VERSION
column.remarks: The TruScan engine version.

column.name: DIS_SUBMIT
column.remarks: Recommendation if this detection should be submitted to Symantec (0 = No, 1 = Yes).

column.name: WHITELIST_REASON
column.remarks:
0 = Not on the permitted application list
100 = Symantec-permitted application list
101 = Administrator-permitted application list
102 = User-permitted application list

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted.

column.name: DISPOSITION
column.remarks: Where the value 127 for DISPOSITION means that there was no reputation data available for this detection.

column.name: CONFIDENCE
column.remarks:
The Confidence level that produced the conviction.
>= 100: Extremely High [100..]
>= 65: High [65..99]
>= 25: Medium [25..64]
>= 10: Low [10..24]
>=1: Symantec knows very little about the file/unknown [1..9]
0 is not a valid value. We can say unknown also for 0.
Default is 0

column.name: PREVALENCE
column.remarks:
The prevalence data for the application
0: Unknown.
1-50: Very low
51-100: Low
101-150: Moderate
151-200: High
201-255: Very high
> 255: Very high
Default is 0

column.name: URL
column.remarks:
The URL determined from where the image was downloaded from.
Default is "".
This field belongs to creator for dropper application
The creator process of the dropper threat.
Default is "".

column.name: WEB_DOMAIN
column.remarks: The web domain.

column.name: DOWNLOADER
column.remarks:
The creator process of the dropper threat.
Default is "".

column.name: CIDS_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Enabled state of CIDS
0 = off
1 = on
2 = not installed
127 = unknown.
Default is 127

column.name: RISK_LEVEL
column.remarks:
The risk level (high, med, low) for the convicted threat.
0 -- Unknown
1 or 2 -- Low
3 -- Medium
4 -- High
Default is 0.

column.name: AGREEMENT_ACK
column.remarks: Agreement acknowledge

table.name: HPP_APPLICATION
table.remarks: Keeps applications detected by TruScan.

column.name: APP_HASH
column.remarks: The hash for this application.

column.name: HASH_TYPE
column.remarks:
The hash algorithm used:
0 = MD5
1 = SHA-1
2 = SHA-256

column.name: COMPANY_NAME
column.remarks: The company name.

column.name: APP_NAME
column.remarks: The application name.

column.name: APP_VERSION
column.remarks: The application version.

column.name: APP_TYPE
column.remarks:
Application type:
0 = Trojan worm
1 = Trojan worm
2 = Key logger
100 = Remote control

column.name: FILE_SIZE
column.remarks: The file size.

column.name: DETECTION_TYPE
column.remarks:
Detection type:
0 = heuristic
1 = commercial application

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row; 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted

column.name: HELP_VIRUS_IDX
column.remarks: The foreign key to the VIRUS table, which provides the help ID for the online Symantec write-up.

column.name: FIRST_SEEN
column.remarks:
The first seen date for the convicted application
Default is 0.
