table.remarks: Keeps the administrator-defined filters for the Computer Status log.

column.name: LASTCHECKINTIME
column.remarks: Last time of check-in with the management server.

column.name: LASTSCANTIME
column.remarks:
Last time computer was scanned:
0 = Past week
1 = Past month
2 = Past three months
3 = Past year
4 = Past 24 hours
5 = Current month

column.name: RELATIVEDATETYPE
column.remarks:
Last check-in time, if relative filtering is used:
0 = The past week.
1 = The past month.
2 = The past three months.
3 = The past year.
4 = The past 24 hours.
5 = The current month.

column.name: OPERATOR
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: PATTERN_IDX
column.remarks:
Hard-coded English string used as key (filters for Antivirus signature version):
WITHIN_RELATIVE_30 = Within the last 30 days
WITHIN_RELATIVE_90 = Within the last 90 days
OUTSIDE_RELATIVE_30 = Older than the last 30 days
OUTSIDE_RELATIVE_90 = Older than the last 90 days

or virus definition revision which results in an < = query on that revision.

column.name: PRODUCTVERSION
column.remarks: Product version by which to filter.

column.name: PROFILE_VERSION
column.remarks: The profile version by which to filter.

column.name: IDS_VERSION
column.remarks: Intrusion prevention system signature version by which to filter.

column.name: GOOD
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: LICENSE_STATUS
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: STATUS
column.remarks: 1 = online, 0 = offline,127 = No filter (all).

column.name: ONOFF
column.remarks:
Auto-Protect Status:
0 = Filter for off, 127 = No filter (all).

column.name: TAMPER_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Tamper Protection status:
0 = Filter for off, 127 = No filter (all).

column.name: REBOOT_REQUIRED
column.remarks:
Restart required status:
1 = Filter for needs restart, 127 = No filter (all).

column.name: AVENGINE_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Antivirus Engine Status:
0 = Filter for off, 127 = No filter (all).

column.name: TPM_DEVICE
column.remarks:
TPM device installed:
1 = Filters on device is installed, 127 = No filter (all).

column.name: SERVERGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of domain names by which to filter.

column.name: CLIENTGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of group names by which to filter.

column.name: PARENTSERVERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of server names by which to filter.

column.name: SITELIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of site names by which to filter.

column.name: R_OS_TYPE
column.remarks:
600 = Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008,
502 = Windows 2003 and Windows XP 64 bit,
501 = Windows XP,
500 = Windows 2000,
400 = Windows NT
000 = Other
-1 = No filter (all).

column.name: HI_STATUS
column.remarks:
Filters on the following compliance status:
0 = Fail
1 = Success
2 = Pending
3 = Disabled
4 = Ignore
127 = No filter (all).

column.name: HI_REASONCODE
column.remarks:
Filters on the following reasons:
0 = Pass
101 = Antivirus version is out-of-date
102 = Antivirus is not running
103 = Script failed
104 = Check is incomplete
105 = Check is disabled
127 = Location changed
-1 = No filter (all).

column.name: SERVICE_PACK
column.remarks: OS service pack, or % for no filter (all).

column.name: WORSTINFECTION_IDX
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: COMPUTERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of computer names by which to filter.

column.name: IPADDRESSLIST
column.remarks: The comma-separated, wild-carded list of IP addresses by which to filter.

column.name: USERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of user names by which to filter.

column.name: INFECTED
column.remarks: 'On' indicates the computer is infected.

column.name: SORTORDER
column.remarks: The column by which to sort, for the Computer Status log.

column.name: SORTDIR
column.remarks: Sort order. Ascending or descending.

column.name: FILVIEW
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: CLIENTTYPE
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: LIMITROWS
column.remarks: The number of rows to use for pagination.

column.name: USERELATIVE
column.remarks: Use relative dates ('on'), or absolute dates.

column.name: REPORT_IDX
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: REPORTINPUTS
column.remarks: Special parameters, if the report needs them.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted.

column.name: FIREWALL_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Firewall status:
0 = Filters on / off, 127 = No filter (all).

column.name: DA_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Download advisor status
Enabled state of DA
0 = off
1 = on
2 = not installed
3 = off by admin policy
127 = unknown.

column.name: PTP_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Proactive threat protection status:
0 = Off
1 = On
2 = Not installed
3 = Off by administrator policy
127 = Unknown
The default is 127.

column.name: CIDS_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Network intrusion prevention status:
0 = Off
1 = On
2 = Not installed
3 = Off by administrator policy
127 = Unknown.
Default is 127.

column.name: DEPLOY_STATUS
column.remarks: See SEM_AGENT.DEPLOY_STATUS. Included again in this table because it represents a filter option.

column.name: CIDS_BROWSER_IE_ONOFF
column.remarks: See SEM_AGENT.CIDS_BROWSER_IE_ONOFF. Included again in this table because it represents a filter option.

column.name: CIDS_BROWSER_FF_ONOFF
column.remarks: See SEM_AGENT.CIDS_BROWSER_FF_ONOFF. Included again in this table because it represents a filter option.

column.name: ELAM_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Early Launch Anti-Malware status:
0 = Off
1 = On
2 = Not installed
3 = Off by administrator policy
127 = Unknown.
Default is 127.

column.name: PEP_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Generic Exploit Mitigation status:
0 = Off
1 = On
2 = Not installed
3 = Off by administrator policy
127 = Unknown.
Default is 127.

column.name: MAC_ADDRESS

column.name: IP_ADDRESS

column.name: DEVICE_DETECTED_TIME

column.name: ALERT

column.name: SEND_SNMP_TRAP
column.remarks: Reflects the send SNMP trap action. It is true if "send" is true.

column.name: USN

column.name: TIME_STAMP

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

column.name: IP_RANGE_END

column.name: POLICY_MODE
column.remarks: Indicates whether policy is in user mode or computer mode.

column.name: LAN_SENSOR
column.remarks: Indicates whether the agent is a LAN_SENSOR.

column.name: CLIENT_ID
column.remarks: GUID in the SEM_CLIENT tablet

column.name: COMPUTER_ID
column.remarks: GUID in the SEM_COMPUTER tablet

column.name: AGENT_ID
column.remarks: GUID in the SEM_AGENT tablet

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

The deleted flag of the schema object:

0 = Not deleted

table.name: LICENSE
table.remarks: Keeps the license information.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

column.name: CHAINID
column.remarks: The foreign key to the table LICENSE_CHAIN.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: TYPE
column.remarks: The license type.

column.name: SERIAL_NUM
column.remarks: The license serial number, which is read from the license file.

column.name: FULFILLMENT_ID
column.remarks: The license fulfillment ID, which is read from the license file.

column.name: SERIAL_ID
column.remarks: License serial id, which is read from the license file.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used to detect data changes.

column.name: START_DATE
column.remarks: The license start date time, which is read from the license file.

column.name: END_DATE
column.remarks: The license end date time, which is read from the license file.

column.name: METER_COUNT
column.remarks: seat count, which is read from the license file.

column.name: GRACE_COUNT_PCT
column.remarks: The percentage value of seats allowed as a grace count. This information is read from the license file.

column.name: WARN_POLICY
column.remarks: The number of days before the license end date to start the license expiration warning. This information is read from the license file.

column.name: GRACE_POLICY
column.remarks: The grace period in days, that are specified in the license file. The end date includes the grace period. The expiration date = the end date, minus the number of days in the grace period.

column.name: PRODUCT_ID
column.remarks: The product code, indicating product type, version, and suffix. This information is read from the license file.

column.name: PRODUCT_NAME
column.remarks: The product name and license type.

column.name: WARN_DATE
column.remarks: The date to start the license expiration warning window, computed based on the end date and the warning policy (the end date, minus the number of warning days).

column.name: EXPIRE_DATE
column.remarks: The end date of the license period.

column.name: GRACE_COUNT
column.remarks: Actual grace count based on the seat count and the grace percentage.

column.name: PRODUCT_TYPE
column.remarks: The product type.

column.name: RENEWAL_URL
column.remarks: The URL for the license renewal, created using the SLIC library API.

table.name: LICENSE_CHAIN
table.remarks: Keeps the license chain information.

column.name: CHECKSUM
column.remarks: foreign key to LICENSE_CHAIN table

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used to detect data changes.

column.name: EXPIRE_DATE
column.remarks: The expiration date of the chain (the end date, minus the number of days in the grace period).

column.name: METER_COUNT
column.remarks: The seat count, which is read from the license file.

column.name: GRACE_COUNT
column.remarks: Actual grace count based on the seat count and the grace percentage.

column.name: WARN_DATE
column.remarks: The date to start the license expiration warning window, computed based on the end date and the warning policy (the end date, minus the number of warning days).

column.name: RENEWAL_URL
column.remarks: The URL for the license renewal, created using the SLIC library API

column.name: CLIENT_PRODUCT_TYPE
column.remarks:
This holds value for SEP, SNAC
SEP=0
SNAC=1

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

table.name: LOCAL_METADATA

Type of local_metadata.
Only support SemLocalSettings at this moment.

column.name: CHECKSUM

column.name: CONTENT
column.remarks: The XML content of the schema object.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
0 = Deleted

table.name: LOG_CONFIG
table.remarks: Keeps logs settings for switching log tables.

column.name: TABLE_LIST
column.remarks: The name of the tables to switch logs.

column.name: THRESHOLD
column.remarks: Tthe threshold of the log count.

column.name: EXPIRATION
column.remarks: The expiration date of the logs.

column.name: CURRENT_TABLE
column.remarks: The current log table name.

column.name: CURRENT_ROWS
column.remarks: The current log count in the log table.

column.name: SWITCH_TIME
column.remarks: The last log switch time.

table.name: NETWORK_SCAN
table.remarks: Keeps temporary data for network scan.

table.name: NETWORK_SCAN_RESULT
table.remarks: Keeps temporary result data for network scan.

table.name: NOTIFICATION
table.remarks: Keeps the notification events.

column.name: TYPE
column.remarks:
VO = Risk outbreak
SO = Outbreak on single computers
VM = Outbreak by number of computers
1V = Single risk event
NV = New risk detected
ID = Virus definitions out-of-date
AF = Authentication failure
AFS = Authentication failure on single server
SE = System event
CS = Client security alert
CSS = Client security alert on single computers
CSM = Client security alert by number of computers
LA = New learned application
CL = Client list changed
DF = Server health
UM = Unmanaged computers
NS = New software package
ED = Enforcer is down
WL = Forced or Commercial application detected
DD = Database down
LE = Paid license expiring
TLE = Trial license expiring
ODC = SEPM is overdeployed with the current license
OLE = Upgrade license expiring

column.name: USER_ID
column.remarks: The administrator's GUID.

column.name: TZ_OFFSET
column.remarks: The time zone offset from when the administrator created the notification, so that the dates in the notification are formatted for the administrator's local time zone.

column.name: SERVERGROUP
column.remarks: The name of the server group(s) to which this notification applies. Comma-separated list, wild-cards allowed.

column.name: CLIENTGROUP
column.remarks: The name of the client group(s) to which this notification applies. Comma-separated list, wild-cards allowed.

column.name: PARENTSERVER
column.remarks: Name of management server(s) to which this notification applies. Comma-separated list, wild-cards allowed.

column.name: COMPUTER
column.remarks: The name of the computer(s) to which this notification applies (comma-separated list, wild-cards allowed).

column.name: VIRUS
column.remarks: The name of the threat(s) to which this notification applies. Comma-separated list, wild-cards allowed.

column.name: SOURCE
column.remarks:
Scan for which this notification applies (hard-coded English string used as key):
% = all
Scheduled Scan
Manual Scan
Real-Time Scan
Heuristic Scan
Console
Definition downloader
System
Startup Scan
Idle Scan
Manual Quarantine

column.name: ACTACTION
column.remarks:
% = No filter (all)
1 = Quarantined
3 = Deleted
4 = Left alone
5 = Cleaned
6 = Cleaned or macros deleted
14 = Pending repair
15 = Partially repaired
16 = Process termination pending restart
17 = Excluded
19 = Cleaned by deletion
20 = Access denied
21 = Process terminated
22 = No repair available
23 = All actions failed
98 = Suspicious

column.name: HYPERLINK2
column.remarks: The hyperlink used to generate the report.

column.name: NTIMES
column.remarks: The number of occurrences required to trigger this notification.

column.name: XMINUTES
column.remarks: The window of time in which the specified number of events must occur in order to trigger the notification.

column.name: EMAIL
column.remarks: The comma-separated list of email addresses to which an email is sent when this notification is triggered.

column.name: LASTRUN
column.remarks: The time stamp for when this notification was last generated.

column.name: TRIGGERED
column.remarks: The time when the alert last triggered.

column.name: LASTRUN_DATA
column.remarks: Any extra data that is needed to provide details in the notification email.

column.name: CATEGORY
column.remarks:
Virus category for which this notification applies:
>= -1 is no filter (all)
>= 1 filters for Category 1 (Very Low) and above
>= 2 filters for Category 2 (Low) and above
>= 3 filters for Category 3 (Moderate) and above
>= 4 filters for Category 4 (Severe) and above
>= 5 filters for Category 5 (Very Severe)
= -1 filters for unknown

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted.

column.name: SYSTEM_EVENT
column.remarks: Which buckets of system events

column.name: SECURITY_EVENT
column.remarks: Which buckets of security events

column.name: DAMPER
column.remarks: The minimum quiet time between alerts, in minutes; 0 means autodamper, which is 60 minutes.

column.name: BATCH_FILE_NAME
column.remarks: The batch file or executable to execute when the notification triggers.

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: The name of the notification configuration.

column.name: IS_MAIL_TO_SYS_ADMIN
column.remarks: The flag for mailing to the System Administrator.

column.name: CLIENTPACKAGE_TYPE
column.remarks: The client package type.

column.name: TZ_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the time zone in which the administrator created the notification, so that emailed reports can display dates in the administrator's local time zone.

column.name: CLIENT_TRIGGERED
column.remarks: The time when the notification condition was last triggered. As of version 12.1.2, this column is used instead of TRIGGERED.

table.name: NOTIFICATIONALERTS
table.remarks: Keeps the notification conditions.

column.name: NOTAG_IDX
column.remarks: The notification that triggered this alert. (Pointer to the table NOTIFICATION.)

column.name: ALERTDATETIME
column.remarks: The time stamp from when the alert was generated.

column.name: SUBJECT
column.remarks: The subject of the alert.

column.name: MSG
column.remarks: The notification alert message's text.

column.name: HYPERLINK
column.remarks: The link to the report with the details about the alert situation.

column.name: ACKNOWLEDGED
column.remarks: The flag that indicates whether the alert has been acknowledged.

column.name: ACKNOWLEDGED_USERID
column.remarks: The GUID of the user who acknowledged this notification.

column.name: ACKNOWLEDGED_TIME
column.remarks: The time when the notification was acknowledged.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row; 0 = Not deleted, 1 = deleted

column.name: PARENTSERVER_IDX
column.remarks: A pointer to the table IDENTITY_MAP (server GUID).

column.name: CLIENTGROUP_IDX
column.remarks: A pointer to the table IDENTITY_MAP (group GUID).

column.name: MESSAGE1
column.remarks: The scan message when the scan started.

column.name: MESSAGE2
column.remarks: The scan message when the scan ended.

column.name: THREATS
column.remarks: The number of threats that the scan found.

column.name: INFECTED
column.remarks: The number of files that the scan found that were infected.

column.name: TOTALFILES
column.remarks: The number of files scanned.

column.name: OMITTED
column.remarks: The number of files that were omitted.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row. 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted

column.name: SCAN_TYPE
column.remarks:
Type of scan:
ScanNow_Quick = Active Scan
ScanNow_Full = Full Scan
ScanNow_Custom = Administrator-defined Scan

column.name: COMMAND_ID
column.remarks: A pointer to the table SEM_JOB; this is the command ID that kicked off this scan (if any).

table.name: SCFINVENTORY
table.remarks: Not used.

column.name: IPSSIGDATE
column.remarks: The date of the IPS signature.

column.name: IPSSIGREV
column.remarks: The revision of the IPS signature.

column.name: SCFVERSION
column.remarks: The firewall version.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row. 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted

table.name: SE_GLOBAL
table.remarks: Keeps system sequence number.

column.name: SEQ_NUM
column.remarks: The latest USN on the site.

table.name: SEM_AGENT
table.remarks: Keeps agent information.

column.name: AGENT_TYPE
column.remarks:
The type of the agent installed:
105 = Symantec Endpoint Protection
151 = Symantec Network Access Control

column.name: R_OS_TYPE
column.remarks: Enum that indicates the operating system on the client computer.

column.name: COMPUTER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the registered computer.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain.

column.name: GROUP_ID
column.remarks: The current group GUID of the agent.

column.name: AGENT_VERSION
column.remarks: The version of the agent software.

column.name: PROFILE_VERSION
column.remarks: The current profile version of the agent.

column.name: PROFILE_SERIAL_NO
column.remarks: The serial number of the agent's current profile.

column.name: PROFILE_CHECKSUM
column.remarks: The current profile checksum of the agent.

column.name: IDS_VERSION
column.remarks: Current IDS version of agent

column.name: IDS_SERIAL_NO
column.remarks: Current IDS serial number of agent

column.name: IDS_CHECKSUM
column.remarks: The current IDS checksum of the agent.

column.name: HI_STATUS
column.remarks:
The Host Integrity status:
0 = Fail
1 = Success
2 = Pending
3 = Disabled
4 = Ignore

column.name: HI_REASONCODE
column.remarks:
The Host Integrity reason code:
0 = Pass
101 = Antivirus version is out-of-date
102 = Antivirus is not running
103 = Script failed
104 = Check is incomplete
105 = Check is disabled
127 = Location changed

column.name: HI_REASONDESC
column.remarks: The Host Integrity description.

column.name: CREATION_TIME
column.remarks: The creation time of the agent.

column.name: STATUS
column.remarks: The online status of the agent: 0 = Offline, 1 = Online

column.name: LAST_UPDATE_TIME
column.remarks: The last time that the agent was online.

column.name: LAST_SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the most recent server to connect.

column.name: LAST_SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the last site to connect.

column.name: ATTRIBUTE_EXTENSION
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: FULL_NAME
column.remarks: The employee's full name.

column.name: EMAIL
column.remarks: The employee's email address.

column.name: JOB_TITLE
column.remarks: The employee's job title.

column.name: DEPARTMENT
column.remarks: The employee's department.

column.name: EMPLOYEE_NUMBER
column.remarks: The employee's employee number.

column.name: EMPLOYMENT_STATUS
column.remarks: The employee's status.

column.name: OFFICE_PHONE
column.remarks: The employee's office number.

column.name: MOBILE_PHONE
column.remarks: The employee's mobile number.

column.name: HOME_PHONE
column.remarks: The employee's home phone number.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

column.name: PATTERN_IDX
column.remarks: A pointer to the table PATTERN.

column.name: AP_ONOFF
column.remarks:
AutoProtect status:
1 = On
2 = Not installed
0 = Off
127 = Not reporting

column.name: INFECTED
column.remarks:
Whether the client computer is infected:
0 = Not infected
1 = Infected

column.name: WORSTINFECTION_IDX
column.remarks:
Severity of the worst detection that was made:
0 = (Severity 0) Viral
1 = (Severity 1) Non-viral malicious
2 = (Severity 2) Malicious
3 = (Severity 3) Antivirus - Heuristic
5 = (Severity 5) Hack tool
6 = (Severity 6) Spyware
7 = (Severity 7) Trackware
8 = (Severity 8) Dialer
9 = (Severity 9) Remote access
10 = (Severity 10) Adware
11 = (Severity 11) Jokeware
12 = (Severity 12) Client compliancy
13 = (Severity 13) Generic load point
14 = (Severity 14) Proactive Threat Scan - Heuristic
15 = (Severity 15) Cookie
9999 = No detections

column.name: LAST_SCAN_TIME
column.remarks: The last scan time for this agent (GMT).

column.name: LAST_VIRUS_TIME
column.remarks: The last time a virus was detected on the client computer (GMT).

column.name: CONTENT_UPDATE
column.remarks: Whether the agent accepts a content update. 1 = Yes, 0 = No

column.name: AVENGINE_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Scan engine status:
1 = On
2 = Not installed
0 = Off
127 = Not reporting

column.name: TAMPER_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Tamper Protection status:
1 = On
2 = Not installed
0 = Off
127 = Not reporting status

column.name: MAJOR_VERSION
column.remarks: Symantec Endpoint Protection's major version.

column.name: MINOR_VERSION
column.remarks: Symantec Endpoint Protection's minor version.

column.name: REBOOT_REQUIRED
column.remarks: Reboot required: 0 = No, 1 = Yes

column.name: REBOOT_REASON
column.remarks:
Format is component = reason ID;component = reason ID..
Components:
AVMAN = Antivirus
LUMAN = LiveUpdate
FW = Network Threat Protection
GUP = Group Update Provider
Reasons:
1 = Risk remediation to complete
2 = Product patch to apply
3 = Content download to apply

column.name: LICENSE_STATUS
column.remarks: For future use.

column.name: LICENSE_EXPIRY
column.remarks: For future use.

column.name: TIMEZONE
column.remarks: The time zone offset of the client computer.

column.name: FIREWALL_ONOFF
column.remarks: Firewall status: 0 = Off, 1 = On, 2 = Not installed, 3 = Disabled by policy, 4 = Malfunctioning, 127 = Not reporting

column.name: FREE_MEM
column.remarks: The amount of free memory that is available.

column.name: FREE_DISK
column.remarks: The amount of free disk space that is available.

column.name: LAST_DOWNLOAD_TIME
column.remarks: The last download time.

column.name: CURRENT_CLIENT_ID
column.remarks: Client that logs on this agent.

column.name: LICENSE_ID
column.remarks: The Symantec Endpoint Protection license ID.

column.name: IS_GRACE
column.remarks: Is the license within its grace period?

column.name: SNAC_LICENSE_ID
column.remarks: SNAC license ID

column.name: PTP_ONOFF
column.remarks:
The enabled state of Proactive Threat Protection:
0 = Off
1 = On
2 = Not installed
3 = Off by administrator policy
127 = Unknown
The default is 127.

column.name: LAST_HEURISTIC_THREAT_TIME
column.remarks: The last time that SONAR detected a risk.

column.name: BASH_STATUS
column.remarks:
SONAR status:
0 = Off
1= On
2 = Not installed
3 = Off by policy
4 = Malfunction
Currently, this status is the same as PTP_ONOFF.

column.name: DA_ONOFF
column.remarks:
The Download Advisor operational state.
The enabled state of Download Advisor
0 = Off
1 = On
2 = Not installed
3 = Off by administrator policy
127 = Unknown
The default is 127.

column.name: CIDS_DRV_ONOFF
column.remarks:
Network intrusion prevention status:
0 = Off
1 = On
2 = Not installed
3 = Off by administrator policy
127 = Unknown
The default is 127.

column.name: CIDS_SILENT_MODE
column.remarks: Indicates whether the IDS driver is installed as an internal component for another protection technology. 0 = No, 1 = Yes

column.name: CIDS_DRV_MULF_CODE
column.remarks:
The IDS error code, if its opstate = 4:
: Possible values for NetworkProtectionErrors:
eIPSOk = 0
eIPSGeneralError
eDriverNotLoaded
eAutoblockFailure
eIDSEngineManagerFailure
eSignatureManagerFailure
eNetworkExclisionManagerFailure
eNetworkInfoManagerFailure
eUDPTrafficManagerFailure
eSymEfaManagerFailure
eProcessTrackerFailure
eSettingsManagerFailure
eWFPHookManagerFailure
eLastNetworkProtectionError = 0xffffffff

column.name: CIDS_BROWSER_IE_ONOFF
column.remarks: Internet Explorer browser protection status (0-4 enumeration).

column.name: CIDS_BROWSER_FF_ONOFF
column.remarks: FireFox browser protection status (0-4 enumeration)

column.name: CIDS_ENGINE_VERSION
column.remarks: The IDS engine version.

column.name: CIDS_DEFSET_VERSION
column.remarks: The IDS definition version number. This version is not used in queries. The definition is in the SEM_CONTENT/PATTERN tables.

column.name: DEPLOY_STATUS
column.remarks:
This is an integer sent by the client to represent the current deployment status. It can be generated by the client itself or by the installer.
302448896=Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager indicated an upgrade package for the client.
302448897=The client decided to accept the upgrade package.
302448898=The client decided to reject the upgrade package.
302449152=The client has requested package information for the upgrade.
302449153=The client has received package information for the upgrade.
302449408=The client hasn't allowed the download of the upgrade package to start.
302449409=The client has successfully downloaded and verified the upgrade package.
302449664=The client failed to apply the upgrade package.
302449665=The client failed to patch the delta.
302449666=The client failed to launch the upgrade installer.
302449667=The client successfully launched the final upgrade installer.
302449920=The client is requesting the full version of the upgrade package due to the delta's failure.
302456832=Install successful.
302460928=Install repair successful.
302465024=Uninstall successful.
302469120=Install failed and rolled back.
302469121=Install failed due to insufficient disk space.
302469122=Install failed due to a launch condition.
302469123=Install failed; a consumer product was found.
302469124=Restart pending.
302456833=Files copied.
302469125=Install failed; a legacy enterprise edition was found.
302469126=Install failed due to non-elevated privileges.
302469127=Install failed due to an incompatible operating system.

column.name: DEPLOY_MSG
column.remarks: This is a free form detailed message sent by the client to elaborate on the deployment status.

column.name: DEPLOY_PRE_VER
column.remarks: The agent version prior to a deployment action.

column.name: DEPLOY_TARGET_VER
column.remarks: The agent version the deployment action is trying to move to.

column.name: DEPLOY_RUNNING_VER
column.remarks: The current version of the agent.

column.name: DEPLOY_TIMESTAMP
column.remarks: The time of the deployment action.

table.name: SEM_AGENT_INFECTION_HISTORY
table.remarks: Holds the infection history for an agent. This table has no primary key.

column.name: SEQ_ID
column.remarks: The unique key number for the reported infection.

column.name: COMPUTER_IDX
column.remarks: The identity of the computer that reported the infection.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: The update serial number (USN) for the reported infection; used by replication.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time stamp of the infection report.

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks: The infection's event ID.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Indicates a flag to mark the row for deletion (0 = not flagged, 1 = flagged).

column.name: EVENT_TIME
column.remarks: The date and time of the reported infection event.

table.name: SEM_APPLICATION
table.remarks: Keeps all applications' information.

column.name: APP_HASH
column.remarks: The checksum of the learned application. Includes the name, path, file checksum, file size, and so on.

column.name: APPLICATION_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the learned application.

column.name: APPLICATION_PATH
column.remarks: The file path of the learned application.

column.name: APP_DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: The description of the learned application.

column.name: CHECKSUM
column.remarks: The file checksum of the application binary.

column.name: FILE_SIZE
column.remarks: The file size of the application binary.

column.name: VERSION
column.remarks: The file version of the application binary.

column.name: LAST_MODIFY_TIME
column.remarks: The last time that the application binary was modified.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

column.name: SHA2
column.remarks: The file's SHA2 algorithm.

column.name: SIGNER_NAME
column.remarks: The signer's name.

column.name: SHA1
column.remarks: The file's SHA1 algorithm.

column.name: INTERESTING
column.remarks: This item indicates whether this application was flagged for detection by the administrator using the Detect Process option in the Centralized Exceptions policy.

column.name: COMPANY_NAME
column.remarks: The company name.

table.name: SEM_CLIENT
table.remarks: Keeps clients' information.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain.

column.name: GROUP_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the group.

column.name: GROUP_IS_OU
column.remarks: Indicates whether the client is from Active Directory.

column.name: OU_GUID
column.remarks: The OU's GUID, if the client is from Active Directory.

column.name: POLICY_MODE
column.remarks: Enum {USER_MODE, COMPUTER_MODE}

column.name: COMPUTER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the registered computer.

column.name: HARDWARE_KEY
column.remarks: The hash of the computer hardware information.

column.name: COMPUTER_NAME
column.remarks: The computer's name.

column.name: COMPUTER_DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the domain to which this computer belongs.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: The computer's description.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The user's logon name.

column.name: FULL_NAME
column.remarks: The user's full name.

column.name: USER_DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The user logon's domain name.

column.name: HASH
column.remarks: The hash of POLICY_MODE, COMPUTER_NAME, COMPUTER_DOMAIN_NAME, USER_NAME, USER_DOMAIN_NAME.

column.name: PIN_MARK
column.remarks: A flag to mark whether this client should synchronize with Active Directory.

column.name: CREATION_TIME
column.remarks: The creation time of the client.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

table.name: SEM_COMPLIANCE_CRITERIA
table.remarks: Keeps the host compliance event details.

column.name: AGENT_SECURITY_LOG_IDX
column.remarks: The foreign key to V_AGENT_SECURITY.AGENT_SECURITY_LOG_IDX.

column.name: ACTION
column.remarks:
The action, a hard-coded English key, which is one of the following:
Check
Remediation

column.name: RULE_NAME
column.remarks: The administrator-provided rule name from the policy.

column.name: RULE_TYPE
column.remarks:
The hard-coded English key for the type of rule. This key is one of the following:
Antivirus
Antispyware
Patch
Service pack
Firewall
Custom
Unknown - fallback when processing log at the server and action ends up null or blank.

column.name: CRITERIA
column.remarks:
The hard-coded English key for compliance criteria. Criteria is one of the following:
as_is_installed = Check that antispyware is installed.
as_is_running = Antispyware is running.
as_signature_ok = Antispyware signatures.
av_is_installed = Antispyware is installed.
av_is_running = Antivirus is running.
av_signature_ok = Antivirus signatures.
file_age_ok = Antivirus signature file age.
file_date_ok = The file date.
file_size_ok = The file size.
file_version_ok = The file version.
file_download = The file has downloaded.
file_exists = The file exists.
file_checksum_ok = The file checksum.
file_execute = CThe file command executed.
fw_is_installed = A firewall is installed.
fw_is_running = A firewall is running.
patch_is_installed = A patch is installed.
reg_value_incr = A registry key DWORD has incremented.
reg_key_exists = A registry key exists.
reg_value_ok = A registry value is OK.
reg_value_exists = A registry value exists.
reg_value_set = A registry value is set.
timestamp_ok = A timestamp.
msg_dlg_ok = Aa message dialog returns true.
os_ok = An operating system.
os_lang_ok = An operating system language.
process_is_running = A process is running (either a user app or a service).
file_delete = A temporary file deletes after execution completes or terminates.
service_pack_ok = A service pack meets specific criteria.
hi_setup = Host Integrity setup.
remediation = Provides the overall status of the remediation.
Unknown = The server's default if the criteria is null or blank.

column.name: TARGET
column.remarks: The target of the criteria, which for example could be the antivirus product name, the firewall product name, the file name, the registry key, the registry value, the patch version, the OS version, the process name, or the service name.

column.name: RESULT
column.remarks:
The result, which is one of the following:
Pass
Fail
Ignore
Error
Postponed (for remediation criteria only)
Unknown (fallback at the server if the criteria or rule ends up without a final status)

column.name: ERROR
column.remarks:
The error, which is one of the following:
unknown = Unknown.
product_unknown = The product is unknown.
file_notfound = The file was not found.
filename_invalid = Invalid file name.
parameter_invalid = The condition parameter is invalid.
parameter_undefined = The policy did not specify the condition parameter.
bad_url = The URL format is invalid.
filedownload_op_err = The URL not is accessible or failed to create the destination file.
time_out = The action timed out.
connection_lost = The connection was lost.
access_violation = There was an access violation on the file.
access_denied = Access was denied.
remediation_abort = The user aborted the remediation.
remediation_postpone = The user postponed the remediation.
createdir_failed = The directory creation failed.
system_err = System error.
runas_noprivilege = The client does not hold a required privilege.
internal_err = Internal error.
os_unknown = Failed to detect the operating system type.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks:
Additional compliance check details. Details are either exception text, or one of the following:
Checksum_blank = The fingerprint value is empty.
Failed_to_get_modification_date = Failed to get the modification date.
NAN = The value is not a number.
Cannot_parse_URL = Cannot parse the URL.
URL_not_accessible_or_failed_to_create_destination_file = The URL is not accessible, or failed to create the destination file.
Download_exceeded_limit = The download exceeded the limit.
Destination = The destination file encountered an access violation.
By_User = The action was initiated by the user.
Access_denied_by_server = Access was denied by the server.
Download_file = The file to download was not found
Process_time_out = The process timed out.
Failed_to_detect_OS_type = Failed to detect OS type.
Application_name_is_empty = The application name is empty.
Probably_software_is_not_installed = The software is probably not installed.
Signature_age_in_seconds_failed = Could not compute the signature's age.
Failed_to_parse_URL = Failed to parse the URL
Missing_or_no_version_info = Missing or no version information.
After_script_file_running = After script file is running.
OS_ignore = The operating system check was ignored.
Save_failed = The save failed.
No_previous_time = No previous time given.
OK_or_YES = The user's response was OK or Yes.
Cancel_or_NO = The user's response was Cancel or No.
Fail_to_get_current_OS_language_version = Could not retrieve the current operating system's language.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

Probably_software_is_not_installed = The software is probably not installed.

Failed_to_parse_URL = Failed to parse the URL
Missing_or_no_version_info = Missing or no version information.
After_script_file_running = After script file is running.
OS_ignore = The operating system check was ignored.
Save_failed = The save failed.
No_previous_time = No previous time given.
OK_or_YES = The user's response was OK or Yes.
Cancel_or_NO = The user's response was Cancel or No.
Fail_to_get_current_OS_language_version = Could not retrieve the current operating system's language.

column.name: USN

column.name: DELETED

The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

table.name: SEM_COMPUTER
table.remarks: Keeps computers' information.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain.

column.name: HARDWARE_KEY
column.remarks: Computer hardware information, as a hash value.

column.name: COMPUTER_NAME
column.remarks: The computer's name.

column.name: COMPUTER_DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the domain to which this computer belongs.

column.name: COMPUTER_DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: A description of the computer.

column.name: PROCESSOR_TYPE
column.remarks: The processor type.

column.name: PROCESSOR_CLOCK
column.remarks: The processor clock.

column.name: PROCESSOR_NUM
column.remarks: The number of processors.

column.name: MEMORY
column.remarks: Physical memory, in KB.

column.name: BIOS_VERSION
column.remarks: The BIOS version.

column.name: TPM_DEVICE
column.remarks: The Trusted Platform Module (TPM) device ID.

column.name: OPERATION_SYSTEM
column.remarks: The operating system name.

column.name: SERVICE_PACK
column.remarks: The service pack installed on the computer.

column.name: CURRENT_LOGIN_USER
column.remarks: The logged-on user.

column.name: CURRENT_LOGIN_DOMAIN
column.remarks: The Windows domain.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

column.name: DISK_DRIVE

column.name: OS_LANG
column.remarks: The operating system language ID. For example: English = 0x09

column.name: HYPERVISOR_VENDOR_ID
column.remarks: The foreign key to the HYPERVISOR_VENDOR table.

table.name: SEM_CONTENT

column.name: PATTERN_IDX

column.name: USN

The deleted flag of the schema object:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

table.name: SEM_JOB
table.remarks: Keeps job name for Command process.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: COMMAND_NAME
column.remarks:
Hard-coded English string that indicates which command was launched. This is the same string placed in the XML for pre-defined name.

Update_Now = Update content.
ScanNow_Full = Do a full scan.
ScanNow_Quick = Do an Active Scan.
ScanNow_Custom = Do a custom scan.
Update_ScanNow_Full = Update content and then do a full scan.
Update_ScanNow_Quick = Update content and do an Active Scan.
Update_ScanNow_Custom = Update content and do a custom scan.
CancelScan = Cancel the scan.
Reboot = Restart.
ApOn = Turn Auto-Protect on.
ApOff = Turn Auto-Protect off.
FwOn = Turn the firewall on.
FwOff = Turn the firewall off.
DeleteQuarantine = Delete from Quarantine.

column.name: COMMAND_DESC
column.remarks: A detailed description of the command.

column.name: SOURCE_SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site from where the command was generated.

column.name: SOURCE_ADMIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the administrator who issued the command.

column.name: CREATE_TIME
column.remarks: The time at which the command was issued by the administrator at the console.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
Deleted row:
1 = Deleted
0 = Not deleted

column.name: SPC_OS_VERSION

column.name: OS_FAMILY

The deleted flag of the schema object:

column.name: PROFILE_SERIAL_NO

column.name: POLICY_LAST_MODIFIED

column.name: IPS_SERIAL_NO

table.name: SERVER_ADMIN_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps administrator activities that occur in server

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the log belongs.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
The severity, which can be one of the following: SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST.
>= 400 is FINER and above.
>=500 is FINE and above.
>=700 is CONFIG and above.
>=800 is INFO and above.
>=900 is WARNING and above.
>=1000 is SEVERE and above.

column.name: ADMIN_NAME
column.remarks: The administrator's name.

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
The unique ID of the administrator event:
0x1001 = The logon succeeded.
0x1002 = The logon failed.
0x1003 = Logoff.
0x1004 = The account was locked.
0x1005 = The account was unlocked.
0x1006 = The account was disabled.
0x1007 = The account was enabled/
0x1008 = The administrator was created.
0x1009 = The administrator was deleted.
0x100A = The administrator was renamed.
0x100B = The password was changed.
0x100C = The administrator properties changed
0x100D = The domain was created.
0x100E = The domain was deleted.
0x100F = The domain properties changed.
0x1020 = The domain was disabled.
0x1021 = The domain was enabled.
0x1022 = The domain was renamed.
0x2001 = The group was created.
0x2002 = The group was deleted.
0x2003 = The group was renamed.
0x2004 = The group was moved.
0x2005 = The group properties changed.
0x2006 = The user was created.
0x2007 = The user was deleted.
0x2008 = The user was moved.
0x2009 = The user was copied.
0x200A = The user policy mode was switched.
0x200B = The user properties changed.
0x200C = The computer was created.
0x200D = The computer was deleted.
0x200E = The computer was moved.lt;br />0x200F = The computer was copied.
0x2010 = The computer policy mode was switched.
0x2011 = The computer properties changed.
0x2012 = The organizational unit was imported.
0x2013 = The domain user was imported.
0x2014 = The LDAP user was imported,
0x3001 = The package was created.
0x3002 = The package was deleted.
0x3003 = The package was exported.
0x3004 = The package was moved to the recycle bin.
0x3005 = The package is now current.
0x3006 = The package was added to another domain.
0x3007 = The package properties changed.
0x3008 = The package deployment was created.
0x3009 = The package deployment was deleted.
0x300A = The package deployment properties changed.
0x300B = The package updated.
0x4001 = The replication partner was registered.
0x4002 = The replication partner was deleted.
0x4003 = The remote site was deleted.
0x4004 = The site properties changed.
0x4005 = The server properties changed.
0x4006 = The database properties changed.
0x4007 = The partner properties changed.
0x4008 = The site license is changed.
0x4009 = The enforcer license changed.
# This may not be used
0x400A = Replicate now.
# This may not be used
0x400B = Back up now.
# This may not be used
0x400C = The external logging properties changed.
# This may not be used
0x400D = The site backup settings changed.
# This may not be used
0x400E = The server was deleted.
# This may not be used
0x400F = The server certificate changed.
0x4010 = Replicate now.
0x4011 = Back up now.
0x4012 = The external logging properties changed.
0x4013 = The site backup settings changed.
0x4014 = The server was deleted.
0x4015 = The server certificate changed.
0x4016 = The enforcer group properties changed.

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, the first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: MSG_ID
column.remarks:
The event description ID. Use this ID to load the localized message (only used when an exception is related to this event).

MSG IDs:

ERROR_MSG_x1 = Unexpected server error.
ERROR_MSG_x2 = Unexpected console error.
ERROR_MSG_x3 = Failed to connect to the server. Make sure that the server is running and your session has not timed out. If you can reach the server but cannot log on, make sure that you provided the correct parameters. If you are experiencing network issues, contact your system administrator.
ERROR_MSG_x4 = Unknown response.
ERROR_MSG_x5 = No response code.
ERROR_MSG_x6 = Invalid response code.
ERROR_MSG_x7 = You are no longer connected to the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager. You must log on again to continue.
ERROR_MSG_x8 = Logon failed.
ERROR_MSG_x9 = Invalid action.
ERROR_MSG_xA = Unable to connect to the database.
ERROR_MSG_xB = Invalid parameter.
ERROR_MSG_xC = Administrator name is already in use.
ERROR_MSG_xD = Administrator not found.
ERROR_MSG_xE = Group not found.
ERROR_MSG_xF = Invalid response data.
ERROR_MSG_x10 = Site not found.
ERROR_MSG_x11 = Query not found.
ERROR_MSG_x12 = The results returned are more than 100 records.
ERROR_MSG_x13 = Only select query is allowed.
ERROR_MSG_x14 = Invalid query statement.
ERROR_MSG_x15 = The data type you selected is not supported.
ERROR_MSG_x16 = You cannot delete all the administrators.
ERROR_MSG_x17 = The action type is null.
ERROR_MSG_x18 = The action type is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x19 = The object GUID is null.
ERROR_MSG_x1A = The object GUID is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x1B = The transaction GUID is null.
ERROR_MSG_x1C = The transaction GUID is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x1D = The domain GUID is null.
ERROR_MSG_x1E = The domain GUID is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x1F = The object type is null.
ERROR_MSG_x20 = The object type is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x21 = There is no connection.
ERROR_MSG_x22 = The connection is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x23 = The file fingerprint is null.
ERROR_MSG_x24 = The policy update is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x25 = Request is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x26 = The SQL query is null.
ERROR_MSG_x27 = The USN is null.
ERROR_MSG_x28 = The USN is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x29 = This method with a domain parameter can only called by System Administrators.
ERROR_MSG_x2A = Invalid SQL query type.
ERROR_MSG_x2B = Invalid SQL query parameter.
ERROR_MSG_x2C = The administrator's user name or password is incorrect. Enter a valid user name and password.
ERROR_MSG_x2D = Domain is disabled.
ERROR_MSG_x2E = The administrator account has no access.
ERROR_MSG_x2F = The administrator account is locked.
ERROR_MSG_x30 = Domain not found.
ERROR_MSG_x31 = The management server does not support RSA SecurID logon.
ERROR_MSG_x32 = The transaction does not exist.
ERROR_MSG_x33 = The transaction rollback failed.
ERROR_MSG_x34 = The transaction commit failed.
ERROR_MSG_x35 = The transaction start failed.
ERROR_MSG_x36 = The object cannot be found.
ERROR_MSG_x37 = The object's content is corrupt.
ERROR_MSG_x38 = The object is concurrently updating.
ERROR_MSG_x39 = The datastore is not connected.
ERROR_MSG_x3A = Datastore error.
ERROR_MSG_x3B = The target site belongs to a different group of sites.
ERROR_MSG_x3C = The top level group cannot be deleted.
ERROR_MSG_x3D = Unable to delete this group because there are still clients or subgroups in the group.
ERROR_MSG_x3E = Unable to delete this group because there are still clients in the group.
ERROR_MSG_x40 = The license has expired.
ERROR_MSG_x41 = You have reached the limit of your license.
ERROR_MSG_x42 = Your license doesn't support this feature.
ERROR_MSG_x43 = Invalid Site License.
ERROR_MSG_x44 = You cannot access this server from this IP address.
ERROR_MSG_x45 = Invalid certificate file.
ERROR_MSG_x46 = Invalid private key file.
ERROR_MSG_x47 = Invalid keystore file.
ERROR_MSG_x48 = Invalid keystore password.
ERROR_MSG_x49 = Failed to write certificate on server.

ERROR_MSG_x4B = The administrator name cannot contain any one of {0} characters.
ERROR_MSG_x4C = The administrator name should not be all dots or spaces.
ERROR_MSG_x4D = An Active Directory node cannot be moved.
ERROR_MSG_x4E = The global or temporary groups cannot be moved.
ERROR_MSG_x4F = The group cannot be moved to any Active Directory node.
ERROR_MSG_x50 = The group cannot be moved to the temporary group.
ERROR_MSG_x51 = The Organizational Unit is already in use.
ERROR_MSG_x52 = You must enter a hostname.
ERROR_MSG_x53 = Failed to connect to the directory server.
ERROR_MSG_x54 = Failed to read {0}.
ERROR_MSG_x55 = The action is null.
ERROR_MSG_x56 = The restore file is invalid.
ERROR_MSG_x57 = Failed to create a folder to which to publish the package.
ERROR_MSG_x58 = You cannot use the same site name as a remote replication site.
ERROR_MSG_x59 = The {0} group was not found.

ERROR_MSG_x65 = Browse Network Error. Make sure that the Computer Browser service in Windows is started and running.
ERROR_MSG_x70 = The domain name is already in use.
ERROR_MSG_x71 = The management server can only query users from the domains it belongs to.
ERROR_MSG_x72 = The management server can only filter users from the domains it belongs to.
ERROR_MSG_x73 = The administrator account does not have permission to perform the requested task.
ERROR_MSG_x74 = Your hard disk {0} space is less than {1}MB and impacts the performance of Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager. You should delete some files to free up space. Symantec recommends that you have a minimum of {2}GB of free disk space.
ERROR_MSG_x75 = Your hard disk {0} space is less than {1}MB. Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager requires more disk space to complete certain tasks. Please delete some files to free up some space. Symantec recommends that you have a minimum of {2}GB of free disk space.

ERROR_MSG_x86 = The file is not found.
ERROR_MSG_x87 = An IO exception occurred.
ERROR_MSG_x88 = There were one or more errors when parsing the file from the client.
ERROR_MSG_x89 = A validation exception occurred.
ERROR_MSG_x90 = Unexpected parameter value.
ERROR_MSG_x91 = Missing named version.

ERROR_MSG_x94 = Missing LuContentPolicy.

ERROR_MSG_x96 = Failed to connect to the specified replication partner server. Verify that the server name and port are correct.
ERROR_MSG_x97 = Invalid Syslog server name.
ERROR_MSG_x98 = The management server has detected and ignored one or more invalid or duplicate entries. Check the following entries in your directory server:
ERROR_MSG_x99 = Domain has been disabled.
ERROR_MSG_x9A = The replication partner does not run the same version as the local site.
ERROR_MSG_x9B = You cannot log on to the console because the server is not synchronized with the database. Upgrade the server, and then log on to the console.
ERROR_MSG_x9C = The replicated software package cannot be found in the cache.
ERROR_MSG_x9D = Remote site [{0}] is downloading LiveUpdate contents and cannot prepare the data until the next round of replication.
ERROR_MSG_x9E = Remote site [{0}] failed to prepare the data for replication.
ERROR_MSG_x9F = Remote site {0} blocks new clients. The client cannot register with remote site {0}.
ERROR_MSG_xA0 = Failed to connect to {0}. Make sure the server can ping or resolve this domain.
ERROR_MSG_xA1 = Unable to load binary file.
ERROR_MSG_xA2 = Error occurred during unzip operation.
ERROR_MSG_xA3 = Unable to load group profile.
ERROR_MSG_xA4 = Unable to generate packlist file.
ERROR_MSG_xA5 = Unable to modify config.xml.
ERROR_MSG_xA6 = Unable to modify setAid.ini file.
ERROR_MSG_xA7 = Unable to generate single .exe.
ERROR_MSG_xA8 = Unable to query database.
ERROR_MSG_xA9 = Unable to load server list.
ERROR_MSG_xAA = Unable to load software package data.
ERROR_MSG_xAF = Not enough disk space on the server. Cannot continue.
ERROR_MSG_xB0 = Your temporary password could not be activated. Make sure that the account for which you requested a password is valid and try again.
ERROR_MSG_xB1 = You must use the most recent link that you were sent to reset your password. If the link does not work, copy the link from the email and paste it into your browser address bar.
ERROR_MSG_xB2 = Domain not found.
ERROR_MSG_xB3 = No email account associated with that logon.
ERROR_MSG_xB4 = The server cannot send the email message to the administrator. Check that the email server is connected, or that the email address (and email credentials) for this administrator are correct.
ERROR_MSG_xB5 = Invalid administrator name.
ERROR_MSG_xB6 = Reset password failed.
ERROR_MSG_xB7 = Email server has not been configured yet.
ERROR_MSG_xB8 = You do not have permission to reset the administrator password. Contact the system administrator at this site to enable the reset password option.
ERROR_MSG_xB9 = Server failed to generate a random password.
ERROR_MSG_xBA = You must wait five minutes before you can request another temporary password.
ERROR_MSG_xBB = The URL to activate this password is incorrect. Copy and paste the URL from the email message again.
ERROR_MSG_xBC = You have successfully activated your password reset request. You can now use the new password to log on to Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager.
ERROR_MSG_xBD = Your password reset link has expired. You must use the link within eight hours of receiving it. To reset your password, click "Forgot your password?" in the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager console logon window.
ERROR_MSG_xBE = Unable to process password reset request. A valid IP address for the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager was not found. Please select or enter a valid IP address and try again.
ERROR_MSG_xBF = The password cannot be reset because your authentication mode is not set to Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager authentication. Any Symantec Endpoint Protection administrator can change your password.
ERROR_MSG_xC0 = The parameters that were passed for the network scan are invalid.
ERROR_MSG_xC1 = The user cancelled the network scan.
ERROR_MSG_xC2 = The network scan timed out. Try to run the scan again.
ERROR_MSG_xC3 = The network scan could not be completed because the .dlls+A192 for Windows ICMP ping could not be found.
ERROR_MSG_xC4 = The network scan could not be completed because the auditparams.txt file is invalid or missing.
ERROR_MSG_xC5 = The network scan could not be completed because of an unknown error. Try to run the scan again later.
ERROR_MSG_xC6 = The network scan timed out for some of the target IP addresses.
ERROR_MSG_xC7 = Unable to load package data. Cannot continue.
ERROR_MSG_xC8 = Not enough disk space on the server. Cannot continue.
ERROR_MSG_xC9 = Failed to copy Host Integrity (HI) Content Library to install packages.
ERROR_MSG_xCA = The logon response from the remote partner is null.
ERROR_MSG_xCB = License information from the remote server is not available.
ERROR_MSG_xCC = The server schema version on the local server is newer than the server schema version of the replication partner on the remote site. Please upgrade the remote server to ensure that the versions match.
ERROR_MSG_xCD = License information from the remote server is not available.
ERROR_MSG_xCE = The server schema version on the local server is older than the server schema version of the replication partner on the remote site. Please upgrade the local server to ensure that the versions match.
ERROR_MSG_xCF = Remote server is not an Enterprise Server.
ERROR_MSG_xD0 = Replication partnership has been deleted from remote site.
ERROR_MSG_xD1 = Replication partnership has been setup between this site and remote site.
ERROR_MSG_xD2 = Invalid password for replication partnership logon.
ERROR_MSG_xD3 = Copy license file to install packages failed.
ERROR_MSG_xD4 = The time difference between the local site and the remote site is more than 10 minutes. Please synchronize server times to ensure correct replication of data.
ERROR_MSG_xD5 = The export folder path is too long. This is probably because the installation path for Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager is too long.
ERROR_MSG_xD6 = Unable to generate a package in .zip format.
ERROR_MSG_xE1 = Invalid administrator name.
ERROR_MSG_xE2 = An error occurred while verifying the signature of your ticket. Contact the administrator to resolve this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE3 = The ticket signature from a certificate keystore is invalid. Contact the administrator to rectify this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE4 = The signed data length received on the ticket is invalid. Contact the administrator to rectify this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE5 = Ticket version not supported by current Symantec Endpoint Protection installation. Contact the administrator to rectify this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE6 = The issue date for the ticket is invalid. Check that system times for the two servers are synchronized.
ERROR_MSG_xE7 = The logon ticket is expired. This can be due to timing differences in servers or an expired ticket being used for logon. Contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xE8 = The Symantec Endpoint Protection domain you are trying to access is currently disabled.
ERROR_MSG_xE9 = The username used for logon is invalid. Contact the administrator to verify that the Symantec Endpoint Protection account associated with your account is valid.
ERROR_MSG_xEA = Cannot add root.
ERROR_MSG_xEB = Cannot delete root.
ERROR_MSG_xEC = The Symantec Endpoint Protection domain used for logon is invalid. Contact the administrator to verify that the Symantec Endpoint Protection domain associated with your account is valid.
ERROR_MSG_xED = The product you are trying to access is not registered. Contact the administrator to verify the registration with the required Symantec Endpoint Protection server.
ERROR_MSG_xEE = An error occurred while validating the ticket for your logon request. Try logging on again and if the error persists, contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xEF = The specified user credentials cannot be used to logon for the current registration. Contact the administrator to update your Symantec Endpoint Protection account mapping.
ERROR_MSG_xF1 = LiveUpdate failed.
ERROR_MSG_xF2 = The new password must be different from the old password. Try again.
ERROR_MSG_xF3 = The version of Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager that you are trying to run is not the same as the version you are trying to connect to. This situation can occur between replication partners, or between the remote console and the management server. Upgrade any replication partners, or download the correct version of the remote console from the management server.
ERROR_MSG_xF4 = Email sending directly to the mail server failed.
ERROR_MSG_xF5 = The latest contents are missing.
ERROR_MSG_xF6 = The latest contents are missing.
ERROR_MSG_xF7 = An error occurred while validating the certificate for your logon request. Please try logging on again and if the error persists, contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xF8 = Create domain failed. The specified domain ID is already in use. Choose another domain ID.
ERROR_MSG_xF9 = LDAP Authentication Failed [path={0}, user={1}]. It may fail due to an invalid account name or password, or the account is currently locked out by domain security policy.
ERROR_MSG_xFA = Your server certificate is not validated. If you trust the server, you must accept the certificate. Log in again and if the error persists, contact your administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xFB = Your command is already entered to be sent to your some of the clients. See the log file for details. Your command will be sent to the client shortly. Check the Command Status on the Monitors page to see the progress of your command.
ERROR_MSG_xFC = Your command is already entered to be sent to your clients. No new entries added. See log file for details. Your command will be sent to the client shortly. Check the Command Status on the Monitors page to see the progress of your command.

column.name: STACK_TRACE
column.remarks: The stack trace of the exception (only used when an exception is related to this event).

column.name: CLIENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the client to which the log belongs.

table.name: SERVER_ADMIN_LOG_2
table.remarks: Keeps administrator activities that occur in server.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the log belongs.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
The severity, which can be one of the following: SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST.
>= 400 is FINER and above.
>=500 is FINE and above.
>=700 is CONFIG and above.
>=800 is INFO and above.
>=900 is WARNING and above.
>=1000 is SEVERE and above.

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
The unique ID of the administrator event:
0x1001 = The logon succeeded.
0x1002 = The logon failed.
0x1003 = Logoff.
0x1004 = The account was locked.
0x1005 = The account was unlocked.
0x1006 = The account was disabled.
0x1007 = The account was enabled/

ERROR_MSG_xA6 = Unable to modify setAid.ini file.
ERROR_MSG_xA7 = Unable to generate single .exe.
ERROR_MSG_xA8 = Unable to query database.
ERROR_MSG_xA9 = Unable to load server list.
ERROR_MSG_xAA = Unable to load software package data.
ERROR_MSG_xAF = Not enough disk space on the server. Cannot continue.
ERROR_MSG_xB0 = Your temporary password could not be activated. Make sure that the account for which you requested a password is valid and try again.
ERROR_MSG_xB1 = You must use the most recent link that you were sent to reset your password. If the link does not work, copy the link from the email and paste it into your browser address bar.
ERROR_MSG_xB2 = Domain not found.
ERROR_MSG_xB3 = No email account associated with that logon.
ERROR_MSG_xB4 = The server cannot send the email message to the administrator. Check that the email server is connected, or that the email address (and email credentials) for this administrator are correct.
ERROR_MSG_xB5 = Invalid administrator name.
ERROR_MSG_xB6 = Reset password failed.
ERROR_MSG_xB7 = Email server has not been configured yet.
ERROR_MSG_xB8 = You do not have permission to reset the administrator password. Contact the system administrator at this site to enable the reset password option.
ERROR_MSG_xB9 = Server failed to generate a random password.
ERROR_MSG_xBA = You must wait five minutes before you can request another temporary password.
ERROR_MSG_xBB = The URL to activate this password is incorrect. Copy and paste the URL from the email message again.
ERROR_MSG_xBC = You have successfully activated your password reset request. You can now use the new password to log on to Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager.
ERROR_MSG_xBD = Your password reset link has expired. You must use the link within eight hours of receiving it. To reset your password, click "Forgot your password?" in the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager console logon window.
ERROR_MSG_xBE = Unable to process password reset request. A valid IP address for the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager was not found. Please select or enter a valid IP address and try again.
ERROR_MSG_xBF = The password cannot be reset because your authentication mode is not set to Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager authentication. Any Symantec Endpoint Protection administrator can change your password.
ERROR_MSG_xC0 = The parameters that were passed for the network scan are invalid.
ERROR_MSG_xC1 = The user cancelled the network scan.
ERROR_MSG_xC2 = The network scan timed out. Try to run the scan again.
ERROR_MSG_xC3 = The network scan could not be completed because the .dlls+A192 for Windows ICMP ping could not be found.
ERROR_MSG_xC4 = The network scan could not be completed because the auditparams.txt file is invalid or missing.
ERROR_MSG_xC5 = The network scan could not be completed because of an unknown error. Try to run the scan again later.
ERROR_MSG_xC6 = The network scan timed out for some of the target IP addresses.
ERROR_MSG_xC7 = Unable to load package data. Cannot continue.
ERROR_MSG_xC8 = Not enough disk space on the server. Cannot continue.
ERROR_MSG_xC9 = Failed to copy Host Integrity (HI) Content Library to install packages.
ERROR_MSG_xCA = The logon response from the remote partner is null.
ERROR_MSG_xCB = License information from the remote server is not available.
ERROR_MSG_xCC = The server schema version on the local server is newer than the server schema version of the replication partner on the remote site. Please upgrade the remote server to ensure that the versions match.
ERROR_MSG_xCD = License information from the remote server is not available.
ERROR_MSG_xCE = The server schema version on the local server is older than the server schema version of the replication partner on the remote site. Please upgrade the local server to ensure that the versions match.
ERROR_MSG_xCF = Remote server is not an Enterprise Server.
ERROR_MSG_xD0 = Replication partnership has been deleted from remote site.
ERROR_MSG_xD1 = Replication partnership has been setup between this site and remote site.
ERROR_MSG_xD2 = Invalid password for replication partnership logon.
ERROR_MSG_xD3 = Copy license file to install packages failed.
ERROR_MSG_xD4 = The time difference between the local site and the remote site is more than 10 minutes. Please synchronize server times to ensure correct replication of data.
ERROR_MSG_xD5 = The export folder path is too long. This is probably because the installation path for Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager is too long.
ERROR_MSG_xD6 = Unable to generate a package in .zip format.
ERROR_MSG_xE1 = Invalid administrator name.
ERROR_MSG_xE2 = An error occurred while verifying the signature of your ticket. Contact the administrator to resolve this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE3 = The ticket signature from a certificate keystore is invalid. Contact the administrator to rectify this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE4 = The signed data length received on the ticket is invalid. Contact the administrator to rectify this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE5 = Ticket version not supported by current Symantec Endpoint Protection installation. Contact the administrator to rectify this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE6 = The issue date for the ticket is invalid. Check that system times for the two servers are synchronized.
ERROR_MSG_xE7 = The logon ticket is expired. This can be due to timing differences in servers or an expired ticket being used for logon. Contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xE8 = The Symantec Endpoint Protection domain you are trying to access is currently disabled.
ERROR_MSG_xE9 = The username used for logon is invalid. Contact the administrator to verify that the Symantec Endpoint Protection account associated with your account is valid.
ERROR_MSG_xEA = Cannot add root.
ERROR_MSG_xEB = Cannot delete root.
ERROR_MSG_xEC = The Symantec Endpoint Protection domain used for logon is invalid. Contact the administrator to verify that the Symantec Endpoint Protection domain associated with your account is valid.
ERROR_MSG_xED = The product you are trying to access is not registered. Contact the administrator to verify the registration with the required Symantec Endpoint Protection server.
ERROR_MSG_xEE = An error occurred while validating the ticket for your logon request. Try logging on again and if the error persists, contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xEF = The specified user credentials cannot be used to logon for the current registration. Contact the administrator to update your Symantec Endpoint Protection account mapping.
ERROR_MSG_xF1 = LiveUpdate failed.
ERROR_MSG_xF2 = The new password must be different from the old password. Try again.
ERROR_MSG_xF3 = The version of Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager that you are trying to run is not the same as the version you are trying to connect to. This situation can occur between replication partners, or between the remote console and the management server. Upgrade any replication partners, or download the correct version of the remote console from the management server.
ERROR_MSG_xF4 = Email sending directly to the mail server failed.
ERROR_MSG_xF5 = The latest contents are missing.
ERROR_MSG_xF6 = The latest contents are missing.
ERROR_MSG_xF7 = An error occurred while validating the certificate for your logon request. Please try logging on again and if the error persists, contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xF8 = Create domain failed. The specified domain ID is already in use. Choose another domain ID.
ERROR_MSG_xF9 = LDAP Authentication Failed [path={0}, user={1}]. It may fail due to an invalid account name or password, or the account is currently locked out by domain security policy.
ERROR_MSG_xFA = Your server certificate is not validated. If you trust the server, you must accept the certificate. Log in again and if the error persists, contact your administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xFB = Your command is already entered to be sent to your some of the clients. See the log file for details. Your command will be sent to the client shortly. Check the Command Status on the Monitors page to see the progress of your command.
ERROR_MSG_xFC = Your command is already entered to be sent to your clients. No new entries added. See log file for details. Your command will be sent to the client shortly. Check the Command Status on the Monitors page to see the progress of your command.
ERROR_MSG_xFD = You must enable at least one domain before you can log on to the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager console.
ERROR_MSG_xFE = You must create a domain before you can log on to the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager console.
ERROR_MSG_xFF = You are not authorized to execute this request.
ERROR_MSG_x100 = Request could not be authorized.
ERROR_MSG_x101 = Only system administrator account is allowed.
ERROR_MSG_x102 = Could not log on to the server because of a hostname mismatch. Learn more at http://www.symantec.com/docs/TECH205165
ERROR_MSG_x103 = Could not browse the network. The Bonjour service is missing. For more information, see the Technical Support article for installing the Bonjour service (http://www.symantec.com/docs/TECH213283).
ERROR_MSG_x104 = Could not browse the network. The Bonjour service is stopped. For more information, see the Technical Support article for installing the Bonjour service (http://www.symantec.com/docs/TECH213283).
ERROR_MSG_x105 = Failed to confirm the server certificate before the request timed out.
ERROR_MSG_x106 = The specified file is not a valid known_hosts file. Choose a valid file and try again.
ERROR_MSG_x107 = The host key for host {0} does not match. Verify the identity of the host or provide an updated known_hosts file and try again.
ERROR_MSG_x108 = The host {0} could not be found in the specified file. Remove the host from the list or provide an updated file that contains the correct host information and try again.
ERROR_MSG_x109 = An unknown error occurred while validating the host {0} against the specified file.
ERROR_MSG_x10A = The setting cannot be updated. This error might occur because the setting was already modified by another administrator. Refresh the management console and try to modify the setting again. If the error persists, a system administrator should run the Database Validation tool to confirm that the database passes a validation check.
ERROR_MSG_x10B = Password verification threshold exceeded.
ERROR_MSG_x200 = Failed to synchronize with the directory server {0}. Check the directory server settings in the management console and try again.

column.name: STACK_TRACE
column.remarks: The stack trace of the exception (only used when an exception is related to this event).

column.name: CLIENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the client to which the log belongs.

table.name: SERVER_CLIENT_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps client activities that occur in server.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the log belongs.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
The unique ID of the client activity event:
1 = Registration succeeded.
2 = Registration failed.
3 = The client reconnected.
4 = The client disconnected.
5 = Downloaded policy.
6 = Downloaded intrusion prevention policy.
7 = Downloaded sylink.xml.
8 = Downloaded AutoUpgrade file.
9 = The server received the log.
10 = The log processing failed.
11 = The server received learned application information.
12 = The server received client information.
13 = Client information processing failed.
14 = A hardware identity change occurred.
15 = Downloaded a file fingerprint list.
20 = Downloaded the content package.
22 = Downloaded the command.

column.name: AGENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent.

column.name: HOST_NAME
column.remarks: The computer name of the client.

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: The logon user name of the client.

column.name: DOMAIN_NAME
column.remarks: The domain name of the client.

column.name: LOG_IDX
column.remarks: Log index unique ID.

column.name: CLIENT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the client to which the log belongs.

table.name: SERVER_ENFORCER_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps Enforcer activities that occur on the server.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
A unique ID of the Enforcer activity:
0x101 = Connected to the Policy Manager.
0x102 = Lost connection to the Policy Manager.
0x103 = Applied policy downloaded from the Policy Manager.
0x104 = Failed to apply policy downloaded from the Policy Manager.
0x105 = Applied the Policy Manager configuration.
0x106 = Failed to apply the Policy Manager configuration.
0x107 = Applied the Policy Manager configuration.
0x108 = Failed to apply the Policy Manager configuration.
0x201 = The Enforcer started.
0x202 = The Enforcer stopped.
0x203 = The Enforcer paused.
0x204 = The Enforcer resumed.
0x205 = The Enforcer disconnected from the server.
0x301 = The Enforcer failover enabled.
0x302 = The Enforcer failover disabled.
0x303 = The Enforcer is in standby mode.
0x304 = The Enforcer is in primary mode.
0x305 = Enforcer short.
0x306 = Enforcer loop
0x401 = Forward engine paused.
0x402 = The forward engine started.
0x403 = The DNS Enforcer enabled.
0x404 = The DNS Enforcer disabled.
0x405 = The DHCP Enforcer enabled.
0x406 = The DHCP Enforcer disabled.
0x407 = Allow All is enabled.
0x408 = Allow All is disabled.
0x501 = The seat number changed.
0x601 = Failed to create a policy parser.
0x602 = Failed to import the policy that was downloaded from the Policy Manager.
0x603 = Failed to export the policy that was downloaded from the Policy Manager.
0x701 = Incorrect customized attribute.

column.name: ENFORCER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the Enforcer.
