column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
A unique ID of the Enforcer activity:
0x101 = Connected to the Policy Manager.
0x102 = Lost connection to the Policy Manager.
0x103 = Applied policy downloaded from the Policy Manager.
0x104 = Failed to apply policy downloaded from the Policy Manager.
0x105 = Applied the Policy Manager configuration.
0x106 = Failed to apply the Policy Manager configuration.
0x107 = Applied the Policy Manager configuration.
0x108 = Failed to apply the Policy Manager configuration.
0x201 = The Enforcer started.
0x202 = The Enforcer stopped.
0x203 = The Enforcer paused.
0x204 = The Enforcer resumed.
0x205 = The Enforcer disconnected from the server.
0x301 = The Enforcer failover enabled.
0x302 = The Enforcer failover disabled.
0x303 = The Enforcer is in standby mode.
0x304 = The Enforcer is in primary mode.
0x305 = Enforcer short.
0x306 = Enforcer loop
0x401 = Forward engine paused.
0x402 = The forward engine started.
0x403 = The DNS Enforcer enabled.
0x404 = The DNS Enforcer disabled.
0x405 = The DHCP Enforcer enabled.
0x406 = The DHCP Enforcer disabled.
0x407 = Allow All is enabled.
0x408 = Allow All is disabled.
0x501 = The seat number changed.
0x601 = Failed to create a policy parser.
0x602 = Failed to import the policy that was downloaded from the Policy Manager.
0x603 = Failed to export the policy that was downloaded from the Policy Manager.
0x701 = Incorrect customized attribute.

column.name: ENFORCER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the Enforcer.

table.name: SERVER_POLICY_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps policy change activities that occur in server.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain which was administered.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
The unique ID of the policy event:
0 = The policy was added.
1 = The policy was deleted.
2 = The policy was edited.
3 = Added a shared policy upon system installation.
4 = Add a shared policy upon a system upgrade.
5 = Add a shared policy upon domain creation.

column.name: OBJECT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent policy.

column.name: ADMIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the administrator who is modifying the policy.

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, the first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: EVENT_DATA
column.remarks: Additional data in binary format. This field is optional.

table.name: SERVER_POLICY_LOG_2
table.remarks: Keeps policy change activities that occur in server.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain that was administered.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
A unique ID of the policy event:
0 = The policy was added.
1 = The policy was deleted.
2 = The policy was edited.
3 = Add a shared policy upon installation to the system.
4 = Add a shared policy upon a system upgrade.
5 = Add a shared policy upon the domain creation.

column.name: OBJECT_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the agent policy.

column.name: ADMIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the administrator who is modifying the policy.

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, the first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: EVENT_DATA
column.remarks: Additional data in binary format. This field is optional.

table.name: SERVER_SYSTEM_LOG_1
table.remarks: Keeps system activities that occur in server.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: Not used; logged as ''.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
The severity, which can be one of the following: SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST.
>= 400 is FINER and above.
>=500 is FINE and above.
>=700 is CONFIG and above.
>=800 is INFO and above.
>=900 is WARNING and above.
>=1000 is SEVERE and above.

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
The unique ID for the system event.

Server events; possible values are as follows:
257 = The management server started up successfully.

259 = The management server shut down gracefully.

Backup events; possible values are as follows:

1026 = The backup data fetch failed.
1027 = The backup file write failed.
1028 = The backup failed.
1029 = The backup succeeded.
1030 = The backup started.

System error events; possible values are as follows:

1282 = The connection to the mail server failed.
1283 = Failed to start the RADIUS Server. The RADIUS port may be in use by another process.

Policy events; possible values are as follows:

1538 = Deleted the intrusion prevention policy.
1539 = Updated the intrusion prevention policy.
1540 = The intrusion prevention policy is up to date.
1541 = Skipped publishing a content revision during a LiveUpdate content policy compilation, as the corresponding binary file exists.

LiveUpdate events; possible values are as follows:

1794 = LiveUpdate succeeded.

1797 = The manual launch of LiveUpdate failed.

1807 = LUALL.EXE exited abnormally.
1808 = LUALL.EXE finished running.
1809 = LUALL.EXE failed.
1810 = Started uploading content to the database.
1811 = The specified LiveUpdate file path does not exist.
1812 = The LiveUpdate content category file has been inserted.
1813 = The LiveUpdate content category file has been updated.
1814 = The client package has been downloaded.
1815 = The client package patching failed.
1816 = New LiveUpdate content has been downloaded.
1817 = There is an error in the LiveUpdate upload URL parameters.
1818 = Failed to download the LiveUpdate content.
1819 = Cleaned up the LiveUpdate downloaded content.
1820 = The Host Integrity template has been updated.

1824 = Failed to update.
1825 = {0} is up-to-date.

1827 = {0} is not available on the LiveUpdate server.
1828 = The Manual LiveUpdate cancelled.
1829 = LiveUpdate was delayed.

Network Audit events; possible values are as follows:
2049 = The Network Audit Search Unagented Hosts was started.
2050 = The Network Audit Search Unagented Hosts finished normally.
2051 = The Network Audit Search Unagented Hosts finished abnormally.
2052 = The Network Audit Client Remote Pushing Install started.

2054 = Network Audit Client Remote Pushing Install finished abnormally.

Rapid Response content events; possible values are as follows:

Certificate events; possible values are as follows:

JDNI events; possible values are as follows:

Send email events; possible values are as follows:

Transaction log truncation events; possible values are as follows:

Rebuild indexes events; possible values are as follows:

5379 = Rebuild Indexes Task failed.

column.name: STACK_TRACE
column.remarks: The stack trace of the exception (only used when an exception is related to this event).

table.name: SERVER_SYSTEM_LOG_2
table.remarks: Keeps system activities that occur in server.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: Not used; logged as ''.

column.name: SITE_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the site to which the log belongs.

column.name: SERVER_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the server to which the log belongs.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
The severity, which can be one of the following: SEVERE, WARNING, INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST.
>= 400 is FINER and above.
>=500 is FINE and above.
>=700 is CONFIG and above.
>=800 is INFO and above.
>=900 is WARNING and above.
>=1000 is SEVERE and above.

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
The unique ID for the system event.

column.name: STACK_TRACE
column.remarks: The stack trace of the exception (only used when an exception is related to this event).

table.name: SYSTEM_REPORT
table.remarks: Keeps the administrator-defined filters for the System logs.

column.name: STARTDATEFROM
column.remarks: The time filter start date.

column.name: STARTDATETO
column.remarks: Time filter end date

column.name: RELATIVEDATETYPE
column.remarks:
0 = The past week.
1 = The past month.
2 = The past three months.
3 = The past year.
4 = The past 24 hours.
5 = The current month.

column.name: SYSTEM_TYPE
column.remarks:
1 = Administrative
2 = Client-Server Activity
3 = Server Activity
4 = Client Activity
5 = Enforcer Activity

column.name: SEVERITY
column.remarks:
For Administrative, Client-Server, and Server Activity:
1000 = Error and above.
900 = Warning and above.
800 = Informational and above.
-1 = No filter (all).

For Enforcer activity and client activity:
0 = Informational and above.
1 = Warning and above.
2 = Error and above.
3 = Fatal.
-1 = No filter (all).

column.name: EVENT_ID
column.remarks:
Blank or a percent sign (%) in this field means no filtering.

For the System > Administrative log:

ADMIN_ADMIN_TYPES=Administrator events. Possible values:
4097 = The logon succeeded.
4098 = The logon failed.
4099 = The administrator logged out.
4050 = The account was locked.
4101 = The account was unlocked.
4102 = The account was disabled.
4103 = The account was enabled.
4104 = The administrator account was created.
4105 = The administrator account was deleted.
4106 = The administrator account was renamed.
4107 = The password was changed.
4108 = The administrator properties are changed.

ADMIN_DOMAIN_TYPES = Domain events. Possible values are as follows:
4109 = The domain was created.
4110 = The domain was deleted.
4111 = The domain properties were changed.
4128 = The domain was disabled.
4129 = The domain was enabled.
4130 = The domain was renamed.

ADMIN_GROUP_TYPES = Group events. Possible values are as follows:
8193 = The group was created.
8194 = The group was deleted.
8195 = The group was renamed.
8196 = The group was moved.
8197 = The group properties were changed.

ADMIN_USER_TYPES = The user events. Possible values are as follows:
8198 = The user was created.
8199 = The user was deleted.
8200 = The user was moved.
8201 = The user was copied.
8202 = The user policy mode was switched.
8203 = The user properties were changed.

ADMIN_COMPUTER_TYPES = Computer events. Possible values are as follows:
8204 = The computer was created.
8205 = The computer was deleted.
8206 = The computer was moved.
8207 = The computer was copied.
8208 = The computer policy mode was switched.
8209 = The computer properties were changed.

ADMIN_IMPORT_TYPES = Import events. Possible values are as follows:
8210 = The Organizational Unit was imported.
8211 = The domain user was imported.
8212 = The LDAP user was imported.

ADMIN_PACKAGE_TYPES = Package events. Possible values are as follows:
12289 = The package was created.
12290 = The package was deleted.
12291 = The package was exported.
12292 = The package was moved to the Recycle Bin.
12293 = The package is now current.
12294 = The package was added to another domain.
12295 = The package properties were changed.
12296 = The package deployment was created.
12297 = The package deployment was deleted.
12298 = The package deployment properties changed.
12299 = The package was updated.

ADMIN_REPLICATION_TYPES = Replication events. Possible values are as follows:
16385 = The replication partner was registered.
16386 = The replication partner was deleted.
16400 = Replicate now.

ADMIN_OTHER_TYPES = Other events. Possible values are as follows:

column.name: EVENT_DESC
column.remarks: Description of the event. Usually, the first line of the description is treated as the summary.

column.name: MSG_ID
column.remarks:
This field stores the hard-coded English string key found to the left of the equal sign (=). To the right is a description of the kinds of error messages that will be queried. % or blank in this field means no filtering (all records). See the following for the list of corresponding MSG IDs that fall into each bucket.

MSG IDs:

ERROR_MSG_x1 = Unexpected server error.
ERROR_MSG_x2 = Unexpected console error.
ERROR_MSG_x3 = Failed to connect to the server. Make sure that the server is running and your session has not timed out. If you can reach the server but cannot log on, make sure that you provided the correct parameters. If you are experiencing network issues, contact your system administrator.

ERROR_MSG_xD5 = The export folder path is too long. This is probably because the installation path for Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager is too long.
ERROR_MSG_xD6 = Unable to generate a package in .zip format.
ERROR_MSG_xE1 = Invalid administrator name.
ERROR_MSG_xE2 = An error occurred while verifying the signature of your ticket. Contact the administrator to resolve this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE3 = The ticket signature from a certificate keystore is invalid. Contact the administrator to rectify this issue.

ERROR_MSG_xE5 = Ticket version not supported by current Symantec Endpoint Protection installation. Contact the administrator to rectify this issue.
ERROR_MSG_xE6 = The issue date for the ticket is invalid. Check that system times for the two servers are synchronized.
ERROR_MSG_xE7 = The logon ticket is expired. This can be due to timing differences in servers or an expired ticket being used for logon. Contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xE8 = The Symantec Endpoint Protection domain you are trying to access is currently disabled.
ERROR_MSG_xE9 = The username used for logon is invalid. Contact the administrator to verify that the Symantec Endpoint Protection account associated with your account is valid.
ERROR_MSG_xEA = Cannot add root.
ERROR_MSG_xEB = Cannot delete root.
ERROR_MSG_xEC = The Symantec Endpoint Protection domain used for logon is invalid. Contact the administrator to verify that the Symantec Endpoint Protection domain associated with your account is valid.
ERROR_MSG_xED = The product you are trying to access is not registered. Contact the administrator to verify the registration with the required Symantec Endpoint Protection server.
ERROR_MSG_xEE = An error occurred while validating the ticket for your logon request. Try logging on again and if the error persists, contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xEF = The specified user credentials cannot be used to logon for the current registration. Contact the administrator to update your Symantec Endpoint Protection account mapping.
ERROR_MSG_xF1 = LiveUpdate failed.
ERROR_MSG_xF2 = The new password must be different from the old password. Try again.
ERROR_MSG_xF3 = The version of Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager that you are trying to run is not the same as the version you are trying to connect to. This situation can occur between replication partners, or between the remote console and the management server. Upgrade any replication partners, or download the correct version of the remote console from the management server.
ERROR_MSG_xF4 = Email sending directly to the mail server failed.
ERROR_MSG_xF5 = The latest contents are missing.
ERROR_MSG_xF6 = The latest contents are missing.
ERROR_MSG_xF7 = An error occurred while validating the certificate for your logon request. Please try logging on again and if the error persists, contact the administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xF8 = Create domain failed. The specified domain ID is already in use. Choose another domain ID.
ERROR_MSG_xF9 = LDAP Authentication Failed [path={0}, user={1}]. It may fail due to an invalid account name or password, or the account is currently locked out by domain security policy.
ERROR_MSG_xFA = Your server certificate is not validated. If you trust the server, you must accept the certificate. Log in again and if the error persists, contact your administrator.
ERROR_MSG_xFB = Your command is already entered to be sent to your some of the clients. See the log file for details. Your command will be sent to the client shortly. Check the Command Status on the Monitors page to see the progress of your command.
ERROR_MSG_xFC = Your command is already entered to be sent to your clients. No new entries added. See log file for details. Your command will be sent to the client shortly. Check the Command Status on the Monitors page to see the progress of your command.
ERROR_MSG_xFD = You must enable at least one domain before you can log on to the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager console.
ERROR_MSG_xFE = You must create a domain before you can log on to the Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager console.
ERROR_MSG_xFF = You are not authorized to execute this request.
ERROR_MSG_x100 = Request could not be authorized.
ERROR_MSG_x101 = Only system administrator account is allowed.
ERROR_MSG_x102 = Could not log on to the server because of a hostname mismatch. Learn more at http://www.symantec.com/docs/TECH205165
ERROR_MSG_x103 = Could not browse the network. The Bonjour service is missing. For more information, see the Technical Support article for installing the Bonjour service (http://www.symantec.com/docs/TECH213283).
ERROR_MSG_x104 = Could not browse the network. The Bonjour service is stopped. For more information, see the Technical Support article for installing the Bonjour service (http://www.symantec.com/docs/TECH213283).
ERROR_MSG_x105 = Failed to confirm the server certificate before the request timed out.
ERROR_MSG_x106 = The specified file is not a valid known_hosts file. Choose a valid file and try again.
ERROR_MSG_x107 = The host key for host {0} does not match. Verify the identity of the host or provide an updated known_hosts file and try again.
ERROR_MSG_x108 = The host {0} could not be found in the specified file. Remove the host from the list or provide an updated file that contains the correct host information and try again.
ERROR_MSG_x109 = An unknown error occurred while validating the host {0} against the specified file.
ERROR_MSG_x10A = The setting cannot be updated. This error might occur because the setting was already modified by another administrator. Refresh the management console and try to modify the setting again. If the error persists, a system administrator should run the Database Validation tool to confirm that the database passes a validation check.
ERROR_MSG_x10B = Password verification threshold exceeded.
ERROR_MSG_x200 = Failed to synchronize with the directory server {0}. Check the directory server settings in the management console and try again.

column.name: ENFORCERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated Enforcer names by which to filter.

column.name: ENFORCER_TYPE
column.remarks:
0 = Gateway Enforcer
1 = LAN Enforcer
2 = DHCP Enforcer
3 = Integrated Enforcer
4 = NAP Enforcer
5 = Peer-To-Peer Enforcer

column.name: SERVERGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma separated, wild-card domain names by which to filter.

column.name: CLIENTGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma separated, wild-card group names by which to filter.

column.name: SITELIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-card site names by which to filter.

column.name: PARENTSERVERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-card server names by which to filter.

column.name: COMPUTERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-card computer names by which to filter.

column.name: IPADDRESSLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-card IP addresses by which to filter.

column.name: USERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-card user names by which to filter.

column.name: POLICYNAMELIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-card policy names by which to filter.

column.name: EVENTSOURCELIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated event names by which to filter.

column.name: SORTORDER
column.remarks: The column by which to sort the log views.

column.name: SORTDIR
column.remarks: Sort direction: DESC = Descending, ASC = Ascending

column.name: LIMITROWS
column.remarks: The number of rows to use for pagination.

column.name: USERELATIVE
column.remarks: Use relative dates ('on'), or absolute dates.

column.name: REPORT_IDX
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: REPORTINPUTS
column.remarks: Special parameters, if the report needs them.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks:
The deleted flag of the schema object:
0 = Deleted
1 = Not deleted

table.name: SYSTEM_STATE
table.remarks: Keeps administrator and site health status information.

column.name: CHECKSUM
column.remarks: The checksum of the XML content.

column.name: CONTENT
column.remarks: The XML content of the schema object.

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: tinyint, NOT NULL

column.name: OWNER
column.remarks: The GUID of the corresponding schema object.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time that the record was modified; used to resolve merge conflict.

column.name: TYPE
column.remarks: The type name of the schema object.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: Update Serial Number; used by replication.

column.name: DOMAIN_ID
column.remarks: The GUID of the domain to which the stated object belongs.

table.name: TASKSTATE
table.remarks: For internal use only. Indicates whether a given process is still running or is hanging.

table.name: THREATREPORT
table.remarks: Keeps the administrator-defined filters for the Risk and TruScan logs.

column.name: STARTDATEFROM
column.remarks: The start date.

column.name: STARTDATETO
column.remarks: The end date.

column.name: RELATIVEDATETYPE
column.remarks:
0 = The past week.
1 = The past month.
2 = The past three months.
3 = The past year.
4 = The past 24 hours.
5 = The current month

column.name: FILTER_TYPE
column.remarks: 1 = Risk, 2 = Proactive Threat Protection

column.name: PRODUCT
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: EVENTTYPE
column.remarks: The possibilities for this column are in the table ALERTMSG.

column.name: ACTUALACTION
column.remarks: The possibilities for this column are in the table ACTUALACTION.

column.name: SOURCE
column.remarks:
Hard-coded English string that is used as a lookup key for scan type:
Scheduled Scan
Manual Scan
Real-Time Scan
Heuristic Scan
Console
Definition downloader
System
Startup Scan
Idle Scan
Manual Quarantine

column.name: SORTORDER
column.remarks: The column by which to sort the log views.

column.name: SORTDIR
column.remarks: Sort direction: DESC = Descending, ASC = Ascending

column.name: SERVERGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of domains by which to filter.

column.name: SERVERGROUPINCLUDE
column.remarks: Whether to include (1) or exclude (0) the domains in the list.

column.name: CLIENTGROUPLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of client groups by which to filter.

column.name: CLIENTGROUPINCLUDE
column.remarks: Whether to include (1) or exclude (0) the client groups in the list.

column.name: PARENTSERVERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of Symantec Endpoint Protection Manager servers by which to filter.

column.name: PARENTSERVERINCLUDE
column.remarks: Whether to include (1) or exclude (0) the servers in the list.

column.name: COMPUTERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of computers by which to filter.

column.name: COMPUTERINCLUDE
column.remarks: Whether to include (1) or exclude (0) the computers in the list.

column.name: IPADDRESSLIST
column.remarks: The comma-separated, wild-carded list of IP addresses by which to filter.

column.name: IPADDRESSINCLUDE
column.remarks: Whether to include (1) or exclude (0) the IP addresses in the list.

column.name: CLIENTUSERLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of users by which to filter.

column.name: CLIENTUSERINCLUDE
column.remarks: Whether to include (1) or exclude (0) the users in the list.

column.name: HPP_APP_LIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of heuristic risks by which to filter.

column.name: THREATLIST
column.remarks: Comma-separated, wild-carded list of risks by which to filter.

column.name: THREATINCLUDE
column.remarks: Whether to include (1) or exclude (0) the risks in the list.

column.name: THREATTYPELIST
column.remarks: The possibilities for this column are in the table VIRUSCATEGORY. It is no longer a list but a single item.

column.name: THREATTYPEINCLUDE
column.remarks: Whether to include (1) or exclude (0) the risk types in the list

column.name: THREATCATEGORY
column.remarks:
= -1 (Unknown)
>= 1 (Very low risk)
>= 2 (Low risk)
>= 3 (Moderate risk)
>= 4 (Severe risk)
>= 5 (Very severe risk)

column.name: LIMITROWS
column.remarks: The number of rows to use for pagination.

column.name: USERELATIVE
column.remarks: Use relative dates ('on'), or absolute dates.

column.name: REPORT_IDX
column.remarks: Not used.

column.name: REPORTINPUTS
column.remarks: Special parameters, if the report needs them.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted.

column.name: FULL_CHARTS
column.remarks: Administrator-specified list of charts to include in the Antivirus Comprehensive report.

column.name: R_OS_TYPE
column.remarks: The operating system type that runs on the client computer.

column.name: RISK_LEVEL
column.remarks:
The SONAR log filter field for the risk level. Values are one of the following:
>= -1 (All)
= 0 (Unknown)
>= 1 (Low)
= 3 (Medium)
= 4 (High)

column.name: WEB_DOMAIN
column.remarks: The risk report filter for the web domain name.

column.name: WEB_DOMAIN_INCLUDE
column.remarks: Indicates whether the web domain filter is in use or not for this particular saved filter. This is not currently used.

table.name: TIME_OF_DAY
table.remarks: Holds hours of a day. This table has no primary key.

column.name: HOUR_ID
column.remarks: Represents the hour of the day (0-23).

table.name: UPGRADE_CONTENT_LOOKUP
table.remarks:
Provides any newly introduced contents or if newer version of contents are available. This table has no primary key.
1. With newer release of SEP, consider that AV_DEFS changes, so while inserting a row with new moniker value, the CONTENT_TYPE should be strictly AV_DEFS, so that we can get latest moniker for AV_DEFS when re run the query on them.
2. With newer release of SEP, if new content is introduced say ABC, then identify a proper CONTENT_TYPE for it, which should be different from available values in CONTENT_TYPE.

column.name: CLIENT_VERSION
column.remarks: The version of Endpoint Protection on which newly introduced contents or a newer version of contents are available.

column.name: OS
column.remarks: The operating system.

column.name: CONTENT_TYPE
column.remarks: The content type, e.g. AV_DEFS.

column.name: CONTENT_ZIP_FILE_NAME
column.remarks: The file name of the newly introduced contents or the newer version of contents.

column.name: CLIENT_MONIKER
column.remarks: The client moniker.

column.name: VERSION
column.remarks: The version of Reporting.

column.name: DBSCHEMA
column.remarks: The database schema version.

column.name: SR_NONCE
column.remarks: For internal use only.

table.name: VIRUS
table.remarks: Keeps the list of threats found in the network.

column.name: VIRUSNAME
column.remarks: Name of virus / threat

column.name: CATEGORY
column.remarks: Current category, as downloaded from Symantec's web site. Values are 1 through 5, where 1 is very low and 5 is very severe; -1 means unknown or not applicable. This rating is only applicable to viral threats.

column.name: MAXCATEGORY
column.remarks: The maximum category that the virus has reached. Values are 1 through 5, where 1 is very low and 5 is very severe; -1 means unknown or not applicable. This rating is only applicable to viral threats.

column.name: TYPE
column.remarks:
Threat type:
0 = Viral
1 = Non-viral malicious
2 = Malicious
3 = Virus and Spyware - Heuristic
4 = Security risk
5 = Hack tool
6 = Spyware
7 = Trackware
8 = Dialer
9 = Remote access
10 = Adware
11 = Jokeware
12 = Client compliancy
13 = Generic load point
14 = Proactive Threat Scan - Heuristic
15 = Cookie

column.name: TYPE2
column.remarks:
The threat location:
0 = Boot virus
1 = File virus
2 = Mutation virus
3 = Macro virus
4 = File virus
5 = File virus
6 = Memory virus
7 = Memory OS virus
8 = Memory mcb virus
9 = Memory highest virus
11 = Virus behavior
12 = Virus behavior
13 = Compressed file
14 = Heuristic

column.name: DISCOVERED
column.remarks: When the threat was first discovered by Symantec, as downloaded from Symantec's web site.

column.name: VID
column.remarks: Unique identifier for a virus, as defined by Security Response.

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = Not deleted, 1 = Deleted.

column.name: PATTERN_IDX
column.remarks: Pointer to the table PATTERN, which protects against this threat/virus.

column.name: TOP_THREAT
column.remarks: 0 = Not a top threat, 1 = Top threat

column.name: LATEST_THREAT
column.remarks: 0 = not a latest threat, 1 = latest threat

column.name: STEALTH
column.remarks:
Assesses how easy it is to determine if a security risk is present on a computer. 0 = No rating; 1, 2 = Low; 3 = Medium; 4> = High; -1 means not applicable
This rating only applies to non-viral threats.

column.name: REMOVAL
column.remarks: The skill level required to remove the threat from a given computer. 0 = No rating; 1,2 = Low; 3 = Medium; 4 >= = High; -1 means not applicable. This rating only applies to non-viral threats.

column.name: PERFORMANCE
column.remarks: Measures the negative impact that the presence of a security risk has on the computer's performance. 0 = No rating, 1, 2 = Low, 3 = Medium, 4>= High; -1 means not applicable. This rating only applies to non-viral threats.

column.name: PRIVACY
column.remarks: The level of privacy that is lost due to the presence of a security risk on a computer. 0 = No rating; 1, 2 = Low; 3 = Medium; 4 >= High; -1 means not applicable. This rating only applies to non-viral threats.

column.name: DEPENDENCY
column.remarks: The number of dependent components that the risk installs. 0 = No rating, 1, 2 = Low, 3 = Medium, 4 >= High, -1 means not applicable. This rating only applies to non-viral threats.

column.name: OVERALL
column.remarks: An average of all the security risk ratings. This rating only applies to non-viral threats.

column.name: DYNAUBER
column.remarks: The uber-category for the risk threat. Links to VIRUSCATEGORY table.

column.name: DYNACAT
column.remarks: A sub-category ID for the risk threat. Links to VIRUSCATEGORY table.

column.name: DETECTION_TYPE
column.remarks: The detection type.

table.name: VIRUSCATEGORY
table.remarks: Lists and defines all possible kinds of threats.

column.name: DYNAUBER
column.remarks: The uber-category ID.

column.name: DYNACAT
column.remarks: The sub-category ID.

column.name: LOCALE
column.remarks: The locale, as an integer.

column.name: TRANSLATION
column.remarks: The translated name.

column.name: CATEGORY_DESC
column.remarks:
Hard-coded English string that is used as a lookup key for a category lookup.
0 = Viral
1 = Non-viral malicious
2 = Malicious
3 = Antivirus heuristic
/* 4 = Security risk */
5 = Hack tool
6 = Spyware
7 = Trackware
8 = Dialer
9 = Remote access
10 = Adware
11 = Jokeware
12 = Client compliancy
13 = Generic load point
14 = Proactive Threat Scan - Heuristic
15 = Cookie

column.name: USN
column.remarks: A USN-based serial number; this ID is not unique.

column.name: TIME_STAMP
column.remarks: The time on the server when the event is logged into the system (GMT).

column.name: DELETED
column.remarks: Deleted row: 0 = Not deleted, 1 = deleted
